In 1998, Siti was chosen to perform during the closing ceremony of [[1998 Commonwealth Games]] in front of [[Queen Elizabeth II]] and her consort, [[Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh|Prince Philip]], among other dignitaries and officials from 70 countries including those from the [[Commonwealth of Nations]].{{cite web|title=Best Ever Commonwealth Games Comes to a Close|url=http://www.utusan.net.my/utusan/info.asp?y=1998&dt=0922&pub=utusan_express&sec=Front_Page&pg=fp_01.htm|date=22 September 1998|work=Utusan Online|publisher=Utusan Online|accessdate=12 May 2013}} In 2005, Siti became the first [[Southeast Asian]] singer, and third [[Asian people|Asian]] singer to perform a solo concert at the [[Royal Albert Hall]], London, while being backed by the [[London Symphony Orchestra]].{{cite web|title=Siti all set for London show.|url=http://www.accessmylibrary.com/coms2/summary_0286-18578861_ITM|author=Hafidah Samat|date=14 January 2005|work=[[New Straits Times]]|publisher=[[AccessMyLibrary]]| accessdate = 28 February 2013}} She was listed second by [[MTV Asia]] in Asia's Best Musical Artiste {{cite web|title=Top of the pops|url=http://www.sea-globe.com/southeast-asia/116-region/490-top-of-the-pops|author=Charlie Lancaster|date=9 May 2010|work=Southeast Asia Globe| accessdate = 31 July 2010}} and [[Channel V]]'s Biggest Asian Artiste in 2005. Later in 2008, she was named as one of Asia's Idol by [[Asia News Network]].{{cite web|title=Asia's Idols|url=http://opinion.inquirer.net/inquireropinion/talkofthetown/view/20080105-110589/Asia%92s_Idols|archive-url=https://archive.is/20130221151407/http://opinion.inquirer.net/inquireropinion/talkofthetown/view/20080105-110589/Asia%92s_Idols|dead-url=yes|archive-date=21 February 2013|date=5 January 2008|work=Inquirer.net – Philippine News for Filipino|accessdate=31 July 2010}} Her success in the Asian region has gained her honorific titles including the "[[Honorific nicknames in popular music|Voice of Asia]]"{{cite web|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/47295336?pos=19&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1357537237%3Aresultset|title=SACC showcase: Dato' Siti Nurhaliza and Krisdayanti|quote="Dato' Siti Nurhaliza is a multiple-award winning Malaysian pop singer-songwriter who has garnered more than 100 local awards. Known as the '''Voice of Asia''', Siti has recorded more than 30 albums including singles. She is also known to have the most number one singles than any other artist in Malaysia."|date=10 April 2010|work=[[New Straits Times]]| accessdate = 7 January 2013}} and "[[Honorific nicknames in popular music|Asia's Celine Dion]]".{{cite web|url=http://web6.bernama.com/bernama/v3/news_lite.php?id=639485|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131110120751/http://web6.bernama.com/bernama/v3/news_lite.php?id=639485|dead-url=yes|archive-date=10 November 2013|title=Siti Nurhaliza's Journey To Stardom Aired on Astro's History Channel|quote=" The diva also became the first Malaysian artiste to ever perform at the prestigious Royal Albert Hall in London, where she was dubbed '''"Asia's Celine Dion"''' by the British press."|date=12 January 2012|work=[[Bernama]]|accessdate=7 January 2013}} ==Life and career== ===Childhood and family (1979–1995)=== Siti was born on 11 January 1979, in Berek Polis (police barrack) [[Kampung Awah]] in [[Temerloh]], [[Pahang]] where she was the fifth child in a family of eight siblings to Tarudin Ismail, a police officer and Siti Salmah Bachik, a housewife.{{cite web|title=Countering Mtv Influence in Indonesia and Malaysia|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=t7FB5WTjGKMC&pg=PA217&dq=siti+nurhaliza+copies&hl=en&sa=X&ei=Y7SoUdT4FenGiwK31oHgAw&ved=0CEMQ6AEwBA#v=onepage&q=siti%20nurhaliza%20copies&f=false|author=Seneviratne, Kalinga|year=2012|work=[[Institute of Southeast Asian Studies]]|publisher=Books.google.com|accessdate=31 May 2013}}{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza|url=http://selebriti.kapanlagi.com/indonesia/s/siti_nurhaliza/|language=id|work=KapanLagi.com – Kalau bukan sekarang, kapan lagi?| accessdate = 3 October 2010}} She comes from a musically-inclined family; her brother, Saiful Bahri Tarudin, and her sisters, Siti Norsaida and Siti Saerah are also singers.{{cite web|title=Siti nafi ditawar jutaan ringgit untuk 'Konsert Seribu Warna'|url=http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=/2009/10/22/mstar_hiburan/20091021165444&sec=mstar_hiburan|language=ms|author=Siti Azira Abd. Aziz|date=22 October 2009|work=mStar Online|accessdate=24 January 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100129021846/http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=%2F2009%2F10%2F22%2Fmstar_hiburan%2F20091021165444&sec=mstar_hiburan|archive-date=29 January 2010|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} Her grandfather was a famous violinist, and her mother used to be a local traditional singer. During her childhood, she was involved in various school activities, including sports and co-curricular activities.{{cite web|title=Siti teruja 'kembali' ke sekolah|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2010&dt=0706&pub=utusan_malaysia&sec=Hiburan&pg=hi_05.htm&arc=hive|language=ms|author=Shazryn Mohd. Faizal|date=6 July 2010|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 13 September 2010}} She attended her pre-school at Tabika Perkep, Balai Polis Kampung Awah, Temerloh where she first showcased her early singing talent at the age of six when she sang "Sirih Pinang",{{cite web|title=Siti teruja 'kembali' ke sekolah|url=http://simplysiti.com.my/dato-siti-nurhaliza/|year=2013|work=SimplySiti.com.my|accessdate=31 May 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130619132232/http://simplysiti.com.my/dato-siti-nurhaliza/|archivedate=19 June 2013|df=dmy-all}} a Malay traditional song, at her kindergarten's certificate-receiving event. She later attended primary school at Sekolah Rendah Kebangsaan Clifford and followed up her secondary education at Sekolah Menengah Kebangsaan Clifford, [[Kuala Lipis]], Pahang. In 1991, when she was 12 years old, she won one of her earliest singing competitions, with the song "Bahtera Merdeka" at the Merdeka Day Singing Contest, a local patriotic song competition.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza terkenang Bahtera Merdeka|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2003&dt=0831&pub=utusan_malaysia&sec=Hiburan&pg=hi_01.htm|language=ms|author=Saharuddin Mustafa|date=31 August 2003|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 31 May 2013}}{{Cite news|title=Will this be you?|url=http://www.accessmylibrary.com/coms2/summary_0286-22475800_ITM|author=New Straits Times Staff|date=10 January 2003|work=New Straits Time|publisher=[[AccessMyLibrary]]| accessdate = 31 May 2013}} During her schooling years, she was active in sports, especially in [[netball]]{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza merakam nostalgia Clifford|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2010&dt=0808&pub=utusan_malaysia&sec=Hiburan&pg=hi_05.htm|language=ms|author=Nor Asikin Hassan|date=8 August 2010|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 31 May 2013}} and this was evident when she participated in two different sports events - netball and 5x80 meter relay during the Fiesta Media Idola 2006 in Kuantan.{{cite web|title=Fiesta Media Idola ‘06 tetap meriah walaupun kecoh|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2006&dt=0420&pub=utusan_malaysia&sec=Hiburan&pg=hi_03.htm|language=ms|author=Nor Fadzillah Baharuddin|date=4 April 2006|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 31 May 2013}} She was also chosen as one the torch bearers to light the games of the Fiesta, marking its opening alongside Malaysian actress, [[Fasha Sandha]]. Coming from a poor family,{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza - Melabur untuk masa depan adik|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2003&dt=0904&pub=utusan_malaysia&sec=Hiburan&pg=hi_01.htm|language=ms|author=Khadijah Ibrahim|date=4 September 2003|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 31 May 2013}} at the age of nine,{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza muncul di Jalan Masjid India|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2006&dt=1113&pub=utusan_malaysia&sec=Hiburan&pg=hi_02.htm|language=ms|author=Muhammad Arif Nizam Abdullah|date=13 November 2006|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 31 May 2013}} Siti had to wake up at 4:00am to help her mother make and sell various homemade [[kuih]] in her neighbourhood, where sometimes, she also had to carry a makeshift table down three flights of stairs to the main road to set up a small stall.{{cite web|title=Antara Permata dan Hati|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/Hiburan/20120729/hi_01/Antara-permata--dan-hati|language=ms|author=Amirah Amaly Syafaat|date=29 July 2012|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 31 May 2013}} She commented that all the hardships have not only helped her to be more frugal when spending, but also to be more confident when communicating with the public. She also jokingly said that the whole experience has helped to improve her vocal skills as she has to shout to call for customers.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza Tidak Ambil Mudah|url=http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=/2011/10/17/mstar_hiburan/20111016112345|language=ms|author=Nizam Abdullah|date=17 October 2011|work=mStar Online|accessdate=31 May 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140201172027/http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=%2F2011%2F10%2F17%2Fmstar_hiburan%2F20111016112345|archive-date=1 February 2014|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} Apart from participating in singing competitions, she also used to follow her uncle, Abdul Rahim Bachik, to invitational shows like wedding ceremonies and dinner parties, which have helped to expose her to performing live. ===Early commercial success (1995–1996)=== {{Listen |filename = Jerat_Percintaan_Clip.ogg |title = "Jerat Percintaan" (1996) |description = Siti Nurhaliza's single that managed to win the 11th [[Anugerah Juara Lagu]]. }} Siti Nurhaliza's family performed at many public local ceremonies in their hometown, such as weddings and public soirées. At the age of 12, Siti began to learn traditional songs from her mother and went on performing the same music genre during special occasions and events. She was also the vocalist for 'Family Group', a small band founded by her uncle, Abdul Rahim Bachik. She started to improve her singing skills by participating in numerous local singing competitions. When she was 14, she went for the audition for [[Asia Bagus]] but failed to go through.{{cite web|title=Siti's inspiring journey|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/78254818?pos=10&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1357535501%3Aresultset|author=Hizreen Kamal|date=6 January 2012|work=New Straits Time| accessdate = 7 January 2013}} Despite her frustration, she did not give up. Two years later, she participated in 1995 [[Radio Televisyen Malaysia|RTM]] Bintang HMI competition at the age of 16 where she auditioned with a song made famous by [[Ruth Sahanaya]], ''Kaulah Segalanya''.{{cite web|title=Siapa Pengganti Siti Nurhaliza?|url=http://www.liriklagu.com/imnogman/Mingguan20021021.html|language=ms|work=Liriklagu.com|accessdate = 6 August 2010}} In the competition, she met [[Adnan Abu Hassan]], the music composer who tutored and helped her with her vocal performance, before she finally won the contest with the song by [[Aishah and The Fan Club|Aishah]], ''Camar Yang Pulang''. She signed a contract with [[:ms:Suria Records|Suria Records]] thus rejecting four other offers from different international recording companies, including [[Sony Music Entertainment|Sony Music]], [[Bertelsmann Music Group|BMG Music]] and [[Warner Music Group|Warner Music]].{{cite web|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/1075960?pos=51&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1284375262%3Aresultset|title=Siti Nurhaliza diburu syarikat rakaman|date=14 June 2009|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search|language=ms|work=Bintang Popular – Berita Minggu|accessdate=13 September 2010}} In 1996, Suria Records released her [[Siti Nurhaliza I|first eponymous self-titled debut album]], and the first single, ''Jerat Percintaan'' won the 11th [[Anugerah Juara Lagu]] In that year too, she won Most Popular Television Entertainer, Most Popular Female Singer, Most Popular Teen Artiste and the top award Most Popular Star in [[Anugerah Bintang Popular]] 1996.{{cite web|title=Arkib Pemenang ABP|url=http://abp.bharian.com.my/Entertainment/ABP/arkibpemenangABP|language=ms|work=Anugerah Bintang Popular Berita Harian 2009|accessdate = 13 April 2011}} ===Career development (1997–1998)=== In 1997, Siti started to become a well-known figure in Indonesia's music industry when her story appeared in one of the most popular magazines in Indonesia, POS Kota, in April 1997's edition.{{cite web|title=Hos Rancangan Tv Indonesia.|url=http://www.simplysiti.com/hos-rancangan-tv-indonesia/|language=ms|work=Berita Harian|accessdate = 29 May 2010}} She was taken as a formidable figure because it was difficult for foreign artists to break through in Indonesian's music industry if the artist has less to offer compared to their own artists. Siti was also said to be the first Malaysian singer to hold a live concert on [[Indosiar]], a popular television station in Indonesia and it was televised nationwide. She has become one of the most influential artists in Indonesia which was evidenced by the series of big scale concerts she held in [[Jakarta]], [[Bandung]], [[Yogyakarta]] and many more cities over the next few years.{{cite web|title=Konser Tunggal Siti Nurhaliza Di Gelar di 5 Kota Indonesia|url=http://musik.kapanlagi.com/berita/konser-tunggal-siti-nurhaliza-di-gelar-di-5-kota-indonesia-0p4a3rs.html|language=id|work=KapanLagi.com – Kalau bukan sekarang, kapan lagi?|accessdate = 3 October 2010}} She also won Best New Artist and Best Song (''Jerat Percintaan'') from [[Anugerah Industri Muzik]] 1997. In 1998, at the early age of 19, she launched her own company on 12 January (one day after her 19th birthday), Siti Nurhaliza Productions (M) Sdn. Bhd. which acts as her official management team.{{cite web|title=Dato' Hajjah Siti Nurhaliza|url=http://sitizone.com/sz/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=30&Itemid=49|language=ms|work=Siti Zone|accessdate=3 September 2010}} Siti made her first and biggest appearance on the international stage during the [[1998 Commonwealth Games]] which was held in [[Kuala Lumpur]], Malaysia where she performed in front of [[Queen Elizabeth II]] and her consort, [[Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh|Prince Philip]] among other dignitaries and officials from 70 Commonwealth countries. She also shared the same stage with two international stars [[Céline Dion]] and [[Rod Stewart]] to entertain the crowd during the closing ceremony.{{cite web|title=Siti all set for London show|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/26918068?pos=33&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1280846939%3Aresultset|date=14 January 2005|work=New Straits Time|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Text Archive|accessdate = 31 July 2010}} The ceremony was televised in 70 nations worldwide, which led her to become known in the international arena for the first time. In November of the same year, she was invited to perform in Japan for five days at the Pop Queen Festival, also known as Saga Fiesta '98.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza dapat pengiktirafan di Jepun|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=1998&dt=1101&pub=utusan_malaysia&sec=Hiburan&pg=et_02.htm&arc=hive|language=ms|author=Saharudin Musthafa|date=1 November 1998|work=Utusan Online|accessdate=13 September 2010}} ===Early international stardom (1999–2005)=== [[File:Siti Nurhaliza.JPG|thumb|left|220px|Siti Nurhaliza attending the red carpet ceremony of the MTV Asia Aid 2005 in Bangkok on 3 February 2005.]] In December 1999, Siti received one of her first international winnings from an international singing competition when she took part in 'Shanghai Asia Music Festival 1999' that was held in China, where she managed to win the Gold Award for the ''[[Asia New Singer Competition]]''. She was also invited in 2000{{cite web|title=Liza Hanim dapat tempat kedua|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2000&dt=1201&pub=utusan_malaysia&sec=Hiburan&pg=et_05.htm&arc=hive|language=ms|date=1 December 2000|work=Utusan Online|accessdate=13 September 2010}} and 2002{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza jumpa doktor pakar di Shanghai|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2002&dt=1027&pub=utusan_malaysia&sec=Hiburan&pg=hi_06.htm&arc=hive|language=ms|date=27 October 2002|work=Utusan Online|accessdate=13 September 2010}} for the same competition as featuring artiste. In the same year earlier in May, she took part in 'South Pacific International Song and Singing Competition 1999' held in [[Gold Coast, Queensland|Gold Coast]], Queensland, Australia where she was crowned with the first place in the category of 'Pop/Top 40 for International Song' beating contestants from all over South Pacific through her single, ''We'll Be As One''. Siti also managed to catch the juries' attention with her vocal prowess,{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza menang anugerah antarabangsa|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=1999&dt=0521&pub=utusan_malaysia&sec=Hiburan&pg=et_02.htm&arc=hive|language=ms|date=21 May 1999|work=Utusan Online|accessdate=13 September 2010}} that finally led her to be awarded with the Best Female Vocal Performance with the same single even though the single was judged by cassette tape/compact disc sent by her recording company to the organiser and not through live performance. For the next few years, Siti took part in 'Voice of Asia 2002' which was held in Kazakhstan, where she performed one of her singles from her third album, ''Purnama Merindu'' and managed to grab the Grand Prix Champion title, the ultimate prize.{{cite web|title=Grand Prix 2002 left for Malaysia.|url=http://www.simplysiti.com/grand-prix-2002-left-for-malaysia/|author=Olesya Ivanova|date=29 August 2002|work=The Almaty Herald|publisher=Simply Siti Nurhaliza Zone|accessdate = 6 August 2010}} In December 2003, she was invited to perform at 2003 Japan and ASEAN Pop Stars Dream Concert 2003 (J-ASEAN Pops 2003), held in [[Yokohama]], Japan, alongside top Japan and [[ASEAN]] artists, including THE BOOM, You Hitoto, INSPi, Leonard Eto, Yuri Chika, Hiroshi Takano and Hideki Kurosawa from Japan.{{cite web|title=Japan and ASEAN Pop Stars Dream Concert 2003 J-ASEAN POPs in Yokohama|url=http://www.mofa.go.jp/region/asia-paci/asean/year2003/concert.html|year=2003|work=Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Japan|accessdate = 28 January 2011}} While ASEAN artists including Hans Anwar & Lo'Ryder (Brunei), Preap Sowat (Cambodia), AB Three (Indonesia), Alexandra (Laos), Lay Phyu & Iron Cross (Myanmar), [[Jolina Magdangal]] (Philippines), Tanya Chua (Singapore), Briohny (Thailand) and Lam Truong (Vietnam). For the concert, a special song was composed by a Japanese composer, [[Kazufumi Miyazawa]] with lyrics by a Singaporean lyricist, [[Dick Lee]] entitled, ''Treasure the World''. The same song was also sung by each singer from each participating country in their native languages, where Siti's version which was in Malay, entitled ''Dunia Milik Kita'' was also performed for the first time during the event. Siti was the first non-Chinese artiste to be invited to perform at the 15th [[Golden Melody Awards]], Taiwan in 2004. Apart from performing solo with ''征服'' (Conquer) cover of [[Na Ying]]'s single,{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza – Lagu Mandarin untuk pasaran Taiwan|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2004&dt=0516&pub=utusan_malaysia&sec=Hiburan&pg=hi_06.htm&arc=hive|language=ms|date=16 May 2004|work=Utusan Online| accessdate = 22 September 2010}} she also sang a duet with [[Leehom Wang]] in a song called ''月亮代表我的心'' ([[The Moon Represents My Heart]]) which is a cover of the late [[Teresa Teng]] and as awards presenter alongside Taiwanese news anchor [[Patty Hou]].{{cite web|title=Asia pop stars sing Golden Melody|url=http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/english/doc/2004-05/09/content_329024.htm|date=9 May 2004|work=China Daily Website – Connecting China Connecting the World| accessdate = 9 May 2004}} She also appeared on a half-hour special program by [[Azio TV]] during her brief four days in [[Taipei]]. She also made her third appearance on [[MTV Asia Awards]] in 2004 held in Singapore, where she performed for the second time in a row for the ceremony with [[Gareth Gates]], the runner up from the first series of England version of [[Idol series|Idol]], [[Pop Idol]], in a song originally by Gareth's himself, '[[Say It Isn't So (Gareth Gates song)|Say It Isn't So]]'. In 2004 also her company Siti Nurhaliza Production (M) Sdn. Bhd. (SNP) produced television programs. With the first musical program Muzikal Aidiladha (Musical of Eid Al-Adha) in conjunction with the Eid Al-Adha.{{cite web|title=Muzikal Aidiladha... dakwah seni Siti Nurhaliza|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2004&dt=0125&sec=Hiburan&pg=hi_04.htm|work=Utusan Online|publisher=Utusan|accessdate=19 February 2013}} After that, the company came up with the Siti Nurhaliza 3D (''Siti Nurhaliza Dari Dalam Diri''), a reality television series that exclusively reveal the private life of Siti Nurhaliza with 13 episodes and airing on [[Radio Televisyen Malaysia|RTM]], a Malaysian public broadcasting network.{{cite web|title=Jadi pengacara, Siti bukan pengacau|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2011&dt=0111&sec=Hiburan&pg=hi_01.htm|work=Utusan Online|publisher=Utusan|accessdate=19 February 2013}} In same year also SNP produced ''Sukan dan Selebriti'' (Sports and Celebrities) programs involving the participation of popular artists and sports personalities in various fields with 26 episodes. In 2005, she was dubbed as The Voice of Asia, when Alicia Keys first introduced her with the title during the [[MTV Asia]] Aid in 2005 held in [[Bangkok]], Thailand due to her powerful vocal, and her outstanding achievements locally and internationally.{{cite web|title=INFO Siti Nurhaliza|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/27210938?pos=12&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1281969466%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=23 February 2010|work=Berita Harian|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Text Archive|accessdate = 16 August 2010}} In the same year, Siti held a successful solo concert at the [[Royal Albert Hall]] in London in April 2005, although the majority of the audience were Malaysians living in the United Kingdom, together with the local citizens. British press compared her performance to those by Celine Dion and cited her as Asia's Celine Dion for her powerful vocal and outstanding performances.{{cite web|title=Siti displays true star power in London|url=http://www.star-ecentral.com/news/story.asp?file=/2005/4/8/music/10607505&sec=music|author=Choi Tuck Wo|date=8 April 2005|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]| accessdate = 8 April 2005}}{{cite web|title=Royal Albert Hall|url=http://www.london-architecture.info/LO-070.htm|work=World Architecture Images – Royal Albert Hall|accessdate=3 February 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120524110228/http://www.london-architecture.info/LO-070.htm|archivedate=24 May 2012|df=dmy-all}}{{cite web|title=Siti: Who forced Maia to wear kebaya?|url=http://www.simplysiti.com/siti-who-forced-maia-to-wear-kebaya/|author=Eri Akbar|date=22 July 2005|work=Simply Siti Nurhaliza Zone| accessdate = 30 April 2010}} During the concert, she was backed by the [[London Symphony Orchestra]] conducted by Indonesian maestro, [[Erwin Gutawa]] where the concert was even attended by the [[Ahmad Shah of Pahang|Sultan]] and [[Sultanah Kalsom binti Abdullah|Sultanah]] of Pahang and royal families from Brunei.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza wows London with wit and elegance|url=http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2005/4/3/nation/10587153&sec=nation|author=Choi Tuck Woo|date=3 April 2005|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|accessdate=31 July 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110622050256/http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=%2F2005%2F4%2F3%2Fnation%2F10587153&sec=nation|archivedate=22 June 2011|df=dmy-all}} In the same year, [[Channel V]] listed her as the Second Biggest Asian Artist for her achievements, trailing behind Taiwanese singer [[Jay Chou]], who is on the top of the list. Coincidentally, [[MTV Asia]] also rated her as the Second Asia's Best Musical Artist, also behind the same Taiwanese artiste, Jay Chou. ===Datukship and ''Transkripsi'' (2006–2007)=== [[File:Malaysian singers various.jpg|thumb|right|270px|Siti Nurhaliza (in white) with fellow Malaysian singers during ''Konsert Suara Hati [[Sudirman Arshad]]'' in 2007.]] Siti's eleventh studio album, ''[[Transkripsi]]'', was released in April 2006 and contained contributions from producers and composers from Indonesia like [[Erwin Gutawa]], [[Melly Goeslaw]] and [[Glenn Fredly]] and Malaysians, like [[Aubrey Suwito]], Cat Farish, Jenny Chin, Firdaus Mahmud, Mac Chew, Yasin and Damian VE.{{cite web|title=Transkripsi|url=http://sitizone.com/sz/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=35&Itemid=55|work=SitiZone| accessdate = 28 December 2009}}{{cite web|title=Hati Siti "berbisik"|url=http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=/2006/1/4/HIBURAN/m_Aduh/Hati_Siti_berbisik&sec=mstar_hiburan|language=ms|author=Zieman|date=4 January 2006|work=mStar Online|accessdate=17 September 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101127191605/http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=%2F2006%2F1%2F4%2FHIBURAN%2Fm_Aduh%2FHati_Siti_berbisik&sec=mstar_hiburan|archive-date=27 November 2010|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} ''Transkripsi'' became the year's best album after winning the Best Pop Album and Best Album categories in the [[Anugerah Industri Muzik]].{{cite web|title=Right AIM|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/43858971?pos=23&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1281544328%3Aresultset|date=20 March 2006|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search|accessdate = 11 August 2010}}{{cite web|title=Saingan sengit finalis AIM14|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/29091996?pos=27&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1281544328%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=30 March 2007|work=Berita Harian|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search|accessdate = 11 August 2010}} It also received praises before by critics as one of her best albums ever produced{{cite web|title=Transkripsi vokal terbaik Siti|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/45946243?pos=38&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1283498893%3Aresultset|date=2 March 2006|work=Harian Metro|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search|accessdate = 3 September 2010}}{{cite web|title=So gloriously Siti|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/22826538?pos=103&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1283498893%3Aresultset|date=11 March 2006|work=New Straits Time|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search|accessdate = 3 September 2010}} and the album released was her debut attempt of producing an album under her own production company.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza di persimpangan dilema|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2006&dt=0514&pub=utusan_malaysia&sec=Hiburan&pg=hi_01.htm&arc=hive|language=ms|author=Tengku Khalidah Tengku Bidin|date=14 May 2006|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 3 May 2010}} On 24 October 2006, she was conferred as "Dato'" after receiving the title of ''Darjah Indera Mahkota Pahang'' (DIMP) from the Sultan of Pahang, [[Ahmad Shah of Pahang|Sultan Ahmad Shah]] on his 76th birthday alongside two Malaysian designers, [[Bernard Chandran]] and Dayang Tom Abang Saufi.{{Cite news|title=Datukship for Siti Nurhaliza|url=http://www.accessmylibrary.com/article-1G1-153443848/datukship-siti-nurhaliza.html|author=M. Hamzah Jamaluddin|date=24 October 2006|work=New Straits Time|publisher=[[AccessMyLibrary]]| accessdate = 18 February 2013}}{{cite web|title=Abdullah heads awards list|url=http://thestar.com.my/news/list.asp?file=/2006/10/24/nation/15807127&sec=nation|date=24 October 2006|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|accessdate=24 October 2006|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071014034431/http://thestar.com.my/news/list.asp?file=%2F2006%2F10%2F24%2Fnation%2F15807127&sec=nation|archivedate=14 October 2007|df=dmy-all}} In 2007, she made her first appearance at the [[Grammy Award]] for the red carpet session on 11 February 2007 where she was the first Malaysian to walk the red carpet.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza gets Grammy invite|url=http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2007/2/6/nation/16791765&sec=nation|date=6 February 2007|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|accessdate=6 February 2007|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070206173859/http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=%2F2007%2F2%2F6%2Fnation%2F16791765&sec=nation|archivedate=6 February 2007|df=dmy-all}} On 20 and 21 April 2007, she performed at the ''Konsert Istana Cinta Nostalgia'', which was a tribute concert for the late [[P. Ramlee|Tan Sri P. Ramlee]] and [[Salmah Ismail|Puan Sri Saloma]] at [[Istana Budaya]], Kuala Lumpur. The concert featured popular songs composed by Tan Sri P. Ramlee himself, performed by Siti and other invited artistes.{{cite web|title=Siti hidupkan khazanah P. Ramlee dalam Konsert Istana Cinta|url=http://mstar.com.my/cms/content.jsp?id=com.tms.cms.article.Article_1caaad31-c0a85061-166a5380-8a00445d|language=ms|author=Zieman|date=24 April 2007|work=mStar Online|accessdate=24 April 2007|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070927231613/http://mstar.com.my/cms/content.jsp?id=com.tms.cms.article.Article_1caaad31-c0a85061-166a5380-8a00445d|archivedate=27 September 2007|df=dmy-all}} Before this, Siti was also invited to perform a tribute concert for the late [[Sudirman Arshad|Sudirman Hj Arshad]], also at [[Istana Budaya]], Kuala Lumpur in 2002. On 30 April 2007, she garnered 4 nominations in the Anugerah Industri Muzik including Best Pop Album (''Transkripsi''), Best Vocal Female Performance in an Album (''Transkripsi''), Best Music Video (''Bisakah'') and Best Cover for an Album (''Transkripsi''). Out of the four nominations, she won two awards – Best Pop Album and Best Album for ''Transkripsi''. She also received five nominations from Anugerah Planet Muzik 2007 for two categories that were voted by fans from Indonesia, Malaysia and Singapore – Most Popular Female Artist and Most Popular Song (''[[Biarlah Rahsia]]'') and three categories that were judged by professional juries and judges – Best Female Artist, Best Song (''Biarlah Rahsia'') and Best Album.{{cite web|title=Penyertaan karyawan muzik Malaysia sedikit|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/29162542?pos=10&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1283398287%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=24 April 2007|work=Berita Harian|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search|accessdate = 2 September 2010}} She won three out of five – Most Popular Female Artist, Best Female Artist and Best Song.{{cite web|title=Siti raih 3 anugerah APM 2007|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/29254115?pos=6&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1283398287%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=9 June 2007|work=Berita Harian|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search|accessdate = 2 September 2010}} ===''Hadiah Daripada Hati'', ''Lentera Timur'' and other works (2007–2008)=== [[File:Siti Nurhaliza.jpg|190px|thumb|left|Siti Nurhaliza backstage during ''Konsert Suara Hati Sudirman Arshad'', a tribute concert in April 2007.]] Siti Nurhaliza was the first Malaysian to be given the honour of walking up the red carpet meant for invited celebrities at the Grammy Awards held at Staples Centre in Los Angeles on 11 February 2007, after she won the two tickets as Best Dressed celebrity at Star World's "Breakfast With the Stars" in conjunction with the 78th Annual Academy Awards. 2007 also showed Siti's participation on soundtracks for films where she recorded two songs for two different films where she sang ''Menanti Pasti'' and ''Hati'' for ''Kayangan'' and ''[[1957: Hati Malaya]]'' respectively. However, only the song ''Hati'' was included in her twelfth studio album, ''[[Hadiah Daripada Hati]]''{{cite web|title=Hadiah hati Siti|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/4278381?pos=18&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1283359228%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=9 December 2007|work=Metro Ahad|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search|accessdate = 2 September 2010}} and also received the award of Best Original Theme Song from Anugerah Festival Filem Malaysia ke-21 (21st Malaysian Film Festival) in 2008.{{cite web|title=Tuah filem hitam putih|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/46608619?pos=19&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1283359228%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=11 August 2008|work=Harian Metro|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search|accessdate = 2 September 2010}} In the same year too she finally agrees to act in a production where she performed as Azizah, P. Ramlee's mysterious lover, in the musical 'Remy ... Kisah P. Ramlee (Remy ... The Story of P. Ramlee), which is a tribute to the late P. Ramlee, staged at Istana Budaya from 19 October to 3 November 2007.{{cite web|title=Siti akhirnya berlakon|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/46159678?pos=34&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1281102256%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=4 August 2007|work=Harian Metro|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search|accessdate = 6 August 2010}} On 10 December of the same year, Siti's twelfth studio album ''[[Hadiah Daripada Hati]]'' was released, with the Latin-influenced pop song ''Ku Mahu'' as the first single of this album and it was featured as the opening theme song for a local Malay drama, Spa-Q.{{cite web|title=(Sesuatu yang dicari peminat ... )|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/28210268?pos=5&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1281102256%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=10 January 2008|work=Berita Harian|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search|accessdate = 6 August 2010}} Later, ''Melawan Kesepian'' was chosen as her second single and was the first track of this album to have a video clip. The song was a remake of a hit that was once popularised by an Indonesian band called Jikustik.{{cite web|title=Lagu Hantaran Daripada Hati 'hidupkan' Wadi Unung|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/1432328?pos=11&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1281102256%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=27 August 2009|work=Berita Harian|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search|accessdate = 6 August 2010}} ''Hadiah Daripada Hati'' came under criticism from the press when it was released. Critics said it was a moderate performance from her and was not on the same par as her previous album ''Transkripsi'', which was touted as the best album she had ever made.{{cite web|title=Siti hilang bisa|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/46483703?pos=4&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1281102256%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=4 March 2008|work=Harian Metro|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search|accessdate = 6 August 2010}}{{cite web|title=Hadiah Siti kurang mantap|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/46451919?pos=5&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1281102256%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=25 February 2008|work=Harian Metro|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search|accessdate = 6 August 2010}} But these criticisms were rebutted when ''Hadiah Daripada Hati'' received five nominations in the 15th edition of AIM including Best Pop Album, Song of The Year, Best Vocal Performance in an Album (Female), Best Arrangement and Best Album Cover making Siti the second nominee with the most nominations after newcomer [[Faizal Tahir]].{{cite web|title=Faizal Tahir Ungguli AIM|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2008&dt=0504&pub=utusan_malaysia&sec=Dalam_Negeri&pg=dn_01.htm&arc=hive|language=ms|author=Shazryn Mohd. Faizal|date=3 May 2008|work=Utusan Online| accessdate = 4 May 2010}}{{cite web|title=Penjurian AIM15 lebih telus|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/28085446?pos=25&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1281102256%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=7 April 2008|work=Berita Harian|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search|accessdate = 6 August 2010}} Out of five categories including three multiple nominations for Best Arrangement category, the album earned her three awards for Best Pop Album, Best Musical Arrangement in a Song (Malay) for the song Cintamu as well as her ninth Best Vocal Performance in an Album (Female) in which she had lost to [[Jaclyn Victor]] the previous year.{{cite web|title=Faizal Tahir Rocks at AIM Awards|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/4850626?pos=2&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1287690590%3Aresultset|work=New Straits Time| accessdate = 4 April 2008}} Her acting debut in the musical 'Remy... The Story of P. Ramlee' also saw the debut of her third single ''Mulanya Cinta'', which was composed by [[Dick Lee]], a Singaporean composer.{{cite web|title=Hadiah hati Siti|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/4278381?pos=12&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1281102256%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=9 December 2007|work= Berita Harian|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search|accessdate = 6 August 2010}} Siti has also become one of the most frequently searched persons on [[Google]] by Malaysian Google users, according to Google's 2007 Malaysia Year-End Zeitgeist, beating celebrities like [[Paris Hilton]] and [[Britney Spears]].{{cite web|title=Hit list|url=http://thestar.com.my/lifestyle/story.asp?file=/2008/1/17/lifeliving/20006763&sec=lifeliving|author=Wong Li Za|date=17 January 2008|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|accessdate=3 January 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110521144251/http://thestar.com.my/lifestyle/story.asp?file=%2F2008%2F1%2F17%2Flifeliving%2F20006763&sec=lifeliving|archivedate=21 May 2011|df=dmy-all}} [[File:Siti Nurhaliza - KLIFF 08.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Siti Nurhaliza performing as the opening act for the Kuala Lumpur International Film Festival 2008.]] In January 2008, she was cited as one of the Asia's Idols by [[Asia News Network]] for her exemplary achievements and gaining the status as the icon of Malaysian entertainment. and on 21 March 2008, Siti held one of her first solo acoustic concert at the [[Esplanade Theatre]] in Singapore. The concert was called ''Diari Hati - Dato' Siti Nurhaliza's Heart'' (Diary of Dato' Siti Nurhaliza's Heart) where she performed numbers of her hits from her latest album, ''Hadiah Daripada Hati'' and previous albums.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza is as popular as ever|url=http://ecentral.my/news/story.asp?file=/2008/9/16/music/1809291&sec=music|author=Azhariah Kamin|date=16 September 2008|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|accessdate=11 September 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121227082913/http://ecentral.my/news/story.asp?file=%2F2008%2F9%2F16%2Fmusic%2F1809291&sec=music|archivedate=27 December 2012|df=dmy-all}} 26 December 2008, was the release date of her 13th album, ''[[Lentera Timur]]'', her most recent traditional contemporary album, [[Traditional music|Irama Malaysia]] (her fourth Ethnic Creative album) since her third one, ''[[Sanggar Mustika]]'' in 2002.{{cite web|title=Lentera Timur|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/4143930?pos=8&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1281102256%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=4 January 2009|work=Harian Metro|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search|accessdate = 6 August 2010}} She commented that the album has more modern and contemporary songs unlike her usual traditional genre.{{cite web|title=Misi angkat muzik tradisi|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/46724902?pos=10&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1281102256%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=16 January 2009|work=Harian Metro|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search|accessdate = 6 August 2010}} For that album, she worked with multiple international composers like Singapore's [[M. Nasir]] and Indonesia's Katon Bagaskara. Nine out of 13 songs (which all was created and composed under three days) that have been chosen came from a songwriting workshop, ''Cipta Ekspress – Berirama Malaysia''. The event which was organised by Malaysian Authors Copyright Protection (MACP) was specially organised to find the materials for the album. Despite of the poor sale due to the lack of promotions, the quality of the album has never been denied where it was evident when during the 16th Anugerah Industri Muzik, ''Lentera Timur'' grabbed multiple awards including Best Pop Ethnic and later on honoured as Album of the Year in AIM 16. She also took home Best Female Vocal trophy for the song 'Di Taman Teman'. She was not present at the award ceremony however as she was away to [[Mecca]] to perform [[Umrah]] with her family.{{cite web|title=Penantian 7 tahun Misha berbaloi, Siti tetap unggul|url=http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=/2009/5/4/mstar_hiburan/20090503021121&sec=mstar_hiburan|language=ms|author=Siti Azira Abd. Aziz|date=4 May 2009|work=mStar Online|accessdate=3 January 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091227184850/http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=%2F2009%2F5%2F4%2Fmstar_hiburan%2F20090503021121&sec=mstar_hiburan|archive-date=27 December 2009|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} Siti has also recorded two songs for the soundtrack for an Indonesian film, ''Perempuan Berkalong Sorban''. One of the songs recorded is a cover of Opick's ''Ketika Cinta'' and also a new song, ''Batasku Asaku'' which was written by Siti herself.{{cite web|title=Siti's Almighty album|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/2133344?pos=2&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1283498893%3Aresultset|date=2 October 2009|work=New Straits Time|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search|accessdate = 3 September 2010}} Both songs were included in her fourteenth album, ''[[Tahajjud Cinta]]''.{{cite web|title=Antara dua dunia Siti|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2009&dt=0811&pub=utusan_malaysia&sec=Hiburan&pg=hi_07.htm&arc=hive|language=ms|author=Shazryn Mohd. Faizal|date=11 August 2009|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 3 September 2010}} In the same year, her wealth is said to have reached RM 50 Million by [[MTV Asia]] and was named one of the millionaires in entertainment in South East Asia. ===SATU, ''Tahajjud Cinta'' and ''CTKD'' (2009)=== On 15 February, her father, Taruddin Ismail 67, died at 11.50 AM, after a heart bypass operation days before does not show any improvement, leaving seven children, and 10 grandchildren behind.{{cite web|title=Ayah Dato' Siti Nurhaliza Selamat Disemadikan|url=http://www.budiey.com/ayah-dato-siti-nurhaliza-selamat-disemadikan/|language=ms|author=Budiey Isma|date=16 February 2009|work=Sensasi Selebriti| accessdate = 11 April 2010}}{{cite web|title=Ayah Siti Nurhaliza Meninggal Dunia|url=http://www.murai.com.my/article/default.asp?article_id=3507&c=1&s=1|language=ms|author=Roslen Fadzil|date=15 February 2009|work=Murai.com.my|accessdate=11 April 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090412061324/http://www.murai.com.my/article/default.asp?article_id=3507&c=1&s=1|archivedate=12 April 2009|df=dmy-all}} She announced a 40-day state of mourning for her father and put singing activity on hold, except for ''Konsert Malam Sinar Maulidur Rasul 1430 Hijrah'' ([[Islamic calendar|1430 Hegira]] Special [[Mawlid]] Night Concert).{{cite web|title=Siti derita ingat abah|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/48148926?pos=5&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1283635241%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=28 February 2009|work=Harian Metro|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search| accessdate = 5 September 2010}} Months after the loss, Siti went back to business where she announced her major three days concert at the Istana Budaya, ''[[SATU Konsert Eksklusif Dato' Siti Nurhaliza]]''. It began its run on 26 June 2009 in Kuala Lumpur. The tickets were sold out weeks before the debut night.{{Cite news|title=SHUIB ON SUNDAY: Can't get enough of Siti|url=http://www.accessmylibrary.com/coms2/summary_0286-38214117_ITM|author=Shuib Talib|date=21 June 2009|work=The New Straits Time|publisher=[[AccessMyLibrary]]|accessdate = 21 June 2009}} The concert received compliments from critics, and the show was attended by distinguished people such as region well-known artistes like Krisdayanti and [[Rossa (singer)|Rossa]] from Indonesia to name some. A month before the concert, she won her ninth consecutive award of Most Popular Malaysian Artist of 2009 and also the Regional Most Popular Artist of 2009 from [[Anugerah Planet Muzik 2009]],{{cite web|title=Siti kekal 9 tahun paling popular serantau APM 2009!|url=http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=/2009/7/19/mstar_hiburan/20090719082421&sec=mstar_hiburan|language=ms|author=Siti Azira Abd. Aziz|date=19 July 2009|work=mStar Online|accessdate=11 April 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100405111053/http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=%2F2009%2F7%2F19%2Fmstar_hiburan%2F20090719082421&sec=mstar_hiburan|archive-date=5 April 2010|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}{{cite web|title=Entertainment: Aizat wins big|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/1368569?pos=4&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1283398287%3Aresultset|author=Dennis Chua|date=22 July 2009|work=The New Straits Time Online|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search|accessdate = 11 April 2010}} beating another 11 contestants where each country, Indonesia, Malaysia, and Singapore has four representatives based on SMS votes.{{cite web|title=APM2009: Siti senarai teratas Artis Serantau Paling Popular!|url=http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=/2009/7/11/mstar_hiburan/20090710164900&sec=mstar_hiburan|language=ms|author=Siti Azira Abd. Aziz|work=mStar Online|accessdate=11 April 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090712122750/http://www.mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=%2F2009%2F7%2F11%2Fmstar_hiburan%2F20090710164900&sec=mstar_hiburan|archive-date=12 July 2009|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} In March, Siti revealed that she would begin work on her next album later in the year. Apparently, the idea came about while Siti was taking part in an Erma Fatima theatre production, Sirah Junjungan. She also stated that, this will be her first attempt at spiritual songs and she plans to release the album for the holy month [[Ramadan]] of 2009 known as ''[[Tahajjud Cinta]]''. In September, she became a host to 13 episodes cooking reality series Citarasa Selebriti Bersama Dato' Siti Nurhaliza with several guest artists.{{cite web|title=Resepi Siti Nurhaliza, Sheila Rusly, Website Kulinari Daisy Chef Liza|url=http://www.budiey.com/resepi-siti-nurhaliza-sheila-rusly-website-kulinari-daisy-chef-liza/|work=Sensasi Selebriti|publisher=Sensasi Selebriti|accessdate=19 February 2013}} Later, Siti and fellow friend, Indonesian singer, Krisdayanti have planned to produce a duet album featuring eight duets where Siti will choose four Malaysian compositions while Krisdayanti will pick the other four from Indonesia. The album was released on 28 December in Malaysia{{cite web|title=Gambar Kulit Album Duet Dato' Siti Nurhaliza & Krisdayanti|url=http://www.budiey.com/gambar-kulit-album-duet-dato-siti-nurhaliza-krisdayanti/|language=ms|author=Budiey Isma|date=25 December 2009|work=Sensasi Selebriti| accessdate = 22 May 2010}} and 27 January in Indonesia,{{cite web|title=Two divas, one album|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/14681132?pos=14&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1283635241%3Aresultset|author=Hizreen Kamal|date=27 January 2010|work=New Straits Time|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search| accessdate = 5 September 2010}} under the name ''[[CTKD: Canda, Tangis, Ketawa, Duka|CTKD]]'' where it is an abbreviation with double meaning where it stands as the acronyms for the combination of both singers names, CT and KD, and also as the whole title of the album, which is ''Canda'' (Joke), ''Tangis'' (Cry), ''Ketawa'' (Laugh) and ''Duka'' (Sad). In July, her skill as a former ambassador for the Malaysian [[Red Crescent Society]] was put to the test when she and a panel doctor of [[Media Prima]] performed a [[Cardiopulmonary resuscitation]] (CPR) on the late [[Yasmin Ahmad]] when she fell unconscious during a presentation in a meeting in [[TV3 (Malaysia)|TV3]]'s headquarter{{cite web|title=Film director Yasmin Ahmad in hospital (Update 7)|url=http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2009/7/23/nation/20090723163731&sec=nation|author=Rizal Johan & Alan Koay|date=23 July 2009|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|accessdate=11 April 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100110051529/http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=%2F2009%2F7%2F23%2Fnation%2F20090723163731&sec=nation|archivedate=10 January 2010|df=dmy-all}}{{cite web|title=Pengarah Yasmin Ahmad selesai jalani pembedahan otak|url=http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=/2009/7/23/mstar_hiburan/20090723171042&sec=mstar_hiburan|language=ms|author=Au Yeong How & Shahril Adzrin|date=23 July 2009|work=mStar Online|accessdate=11 April 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100405074728/http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=%2F2009%2F7%2F23%2Fmstar_hiburan%2F20090723171042&sec=mstar_hiburan|archive-date=5 April 2010|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} and in August, Siti was given a privileged of her own channel on [[Astro (Malaysian satellite television)|Astro]] at Channel 188, Channel Siti for 28 hours on 30 August 2009 which has broadcast her concert in June of the same year, ''SATU Konsert Eksklusif Dato' Siti Nurhaliza'', her previous concert which was held at [[Bukit Jalil]], the Siti's Fantasia Tour concert in 2004 and some of her music videos.{{cite web|title=Tune in to SITI TV this Merdeka|url=http://www.mmail.com.my/content/11945-tune-siti-tv-merdeka|language=ms|work=The Malay Mail|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110628221815/http://www.mmail.com.my/content/11945-tune-siti-tv-merdeka|archivedate=28 June 2011|accessdate=12 May 2013|deadurl=yes|df=dmy-all}} ===Bagaikan Sakti and SimplySiti (2010-2011)=== {{Double image|left|Siti Nurhaliza - SimplySiti Kuching 2010.jpg|310|Siti Nurhaliza - SimplySiti Brunei.jpg|140|Siti promoting SimplySiti in both Malaysia (''left'') and Brunei (''right'') markets in 2010 and 2011.}} In 2010, she performed at ''Konsert Bagaikan Sakti'' which was held in [[Esplanade Theatre|Esplanade – Theatres on the Bay]], Singapore alongside Malaysian producer-composer-songwriter, M. Nasir which also was broadcast live through Astro Box Office Events (Channel 955) on 1 January, and the repeat show from 2nd till 10 January.{{cite web|title=Astro Siarkan Secara Langsung Konsert Bagaikan Sakti M.Nasir & Datuk Siti Nurhaliza|url=http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=/2009/12/19/mstar_hiburan/20091218091312&sec=mstar_hiburan|language=ms|work=mStar|accessdate=18 January 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091221003852/http://www.mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=%2F2009%2F12%2F19%2Fmstar_hiburan%2F20091218091312&sec=mstar_hiburan|archive-date=21 December 2009|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} Her own company, Siti Nurhaliza Productions (M) Sdn. Bhd. has also produced a concert for two Malaysian award-winning artists, Faizal Tahir and Aizat entitled ''Konsert Satu Suara'' which was accompanied by Simfoni Orkestra Kebangsaan (National Orchestra Symphony) on 12 February until 14th at Istana Budaya.{{cite web|title=Siti Akan Terbitkan Konsert Aizat & Faizal Tahir di IB|url=http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=/2009/12/13/mstar_hiburan/20091212192136&sec=mstar_hiburan|author=Wahi Aziz|date=13 December 2009|language=ms|work=mStar Online|accessdate=18 January 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100118112932/http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=%2F2009%2F12%2F13%2Fmstar_hiburan%2F20091212192136&sec=mstar_hiburan|archive-date=18 January 2010|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} On 25 March, she received her first award of the year, ''Anugerah Artis Contoh HIP TV 2009'' (HIP TV Role Model Artist Award 2009){{cite web|title=Keputusan Undian SMS Parti HIP TV Memuaskan|url=http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=/2010/4/4/mstar_hiburan/20100403151010&sec=mstar_hiburan|date=4 April 2009|language=ms|work=mStar Online|accessdate=6 April 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110722232708/http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=%2F2010%2F4%2F4%2Fmstar_hiburan%2F20100403151010&sec=mstar_hiburan|archive-date=22 July 2011|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} defeating four other candidates based on votes from viewers through short message service (SMS).{{cite web|title=Artis Tak Harap Pada Rupa Antara Kelainan 'Parti HIP TV'|url=http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=/2010/3/31/mstar_hiburan/20100330104741&sec=mstar_hiburan|language=ms|author=Siti Azira Abd. Aziz|date=31 March 2009|work=mStar Online|accessdate=6 April 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110722232718/http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=%2F2010%2F3%2F31%2Fmstar_hiburan%2F20100330104741&sec=mstar_hiburan|archive-date=22 July 2011|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} On 30 March, she launched her own beauty and cosmetic products under the name [[SimplySiti]]. The products underwent research and development in Korea, and are incorporated with [[Nanotechnology]] before receiving approval of Halal status by [[JAKIM]].{{cite web|title=Siti perkenal SimplySiti|url=http://www.bharian.com.my/bharian/articles/SitiperkenalSimplySiti/Article/index_html|language=ms|author=Farihad Shalla Mahmud|date=31 March 2009|work=Berita Harian online| accessdate = 6 April 2010}} 6 days later, she received her 13th consecutive award of ''Penyanyi Wanita Paling Popular 2009'' (Most Popular Female Singer 2009) and the overall category award, ''Bintang Paling Popular 2009'' (Most Popular Artist of 2009) from Anugerah Bintang Popular Bintang Harian 2009 with votes from over 225 300 votes from the readers of [[Berita Harian]]. The latter one is her seventh time winning the same accolade.{{cite web|title=ABPBH 2009: Siti Nurhaliza paling popular|url=http://www.bharian.com.my/bharian/articles/ABPBH2009_SitiNurhalizapalingpopular/Article/|language=ms|author=Akmal Abdullah|date=5 April 2010|work=Berita Harian Online| accessdate = 6 April 2010}} On 21 April, Siti won herself another two awards based on popular votes through SMS service from Anugerah Pilihan Pembaca Media Hiburan (APPMH) 2009/10 (Media Hiburan Readers' Choice Awards 2009/10). She won the award for ''Artis Wanita Berkulit Cantik 2009/10'' (Female Artist with a Flawless Skin 2009/10) and special piece of the ceremony, ''Anugerah Khas APPMH 2009/10'' (Special Award of APPMH 2009/10).{{cite web|title=Senarai Pemenang Anugerah PPMH Ulangtahun Ke 25 Media Hiburan|url=http://www.budiey.com/senarai-pemenang-anugerah-ppmh-ulangtahun-ke-25-media-hiburan/|author=Budiey Isma|date=22 April 2010|language=ms|work=Sensasi Selebriti| accessdate = 26 June 2010}}{{cite web|title=Gambar Dato' Siti Nurhaliza di Anugerah PPMH Media Hiburan|url=http://www.budiey.com/gambar-dato-siti-nurhaliza-di-anugerah-ppmh-media-hiburan/|author=Budiey Isma|date=22 April 2010|language=ms|work=Sensasi Selebriti| accessdate = 26 August 2010}} In addition, on 2 May, she won herself her sixth and seventh awards of 2010 from Anugerah Industri Muzik (AIM) ke-17 2010 (17th Malaysian Music Industry Awards 2010) where she won two vocal awards, ''Persembahan Vokal Terbaik Dalam Lagu (Wanita)'' (Best Vocal Performance in a Song (Female)) through her single, ''Ku Percaya Ada Cinta'' and ''Persembahan Vokal Berkumpulan Dalam Lagu'' (Best Group Vocal Performance in a Song) through her single, ''Amarah'' from her collaboration album with Indonesian artiste, Krisdayanti, ''CTKD''. This is her 11th time winning Best Vocal Performance out of 17 years history of AIM, creating a record of her own.{{cite web|title=Yuna wins big at AIM awards|url=http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2010/5/3/nation/6179466&sec=nation|author=Azhariah Kamin|date=3 May 2010|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]| accessdate = 3 May 2010}}{{cite web|title=Siti tetap unggul|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/47789940?pos=8&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1287689923%3Aresultset|language=ms|author=Esme Johari Wahab|date=3 May 2010|work=myMetro| accessdate = 3 May 2010}} She also won another two awards from local fashion magazine, EH! voted by users through online and mail poles, Anugerah Stail EH! 2010 (EH!'s 2010 Style Awards) for the category of ''Selebriti Pencapaian Terbaik'' (Celebrity with the Best Achievements) and ''Selebriti Contoh'' (Role Model Celebrity) on 21 July.{{cite web|title=Kerana Cantik & Seksi, Rozita Menang|url=http://www.murai.com.my/article/default.asp?article_id=7394&c=30&s=152|language=ms|author=Haswari Ali|date=22 July 2010|work=Murai.com.my|accessdate=22 July 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100831105800/http://www.murai.com.my/article/default.asp?article_id=7394&c=30&s=152|archivedate=31 August 2010|df=dmy-all}} Less than two months after being commercialised since late March, her skincare products range, SimplySiti received "The Best Halal Product" under Cosmetic category by Halal Journal Magazine.{{cite web|title=SimplySiti Terima Anugerah Produk Halal Terbaik|url=http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=/2010/5/29/mstar_hiburan/20100528193655&sec=mstar_hiburan|language=ms|author=Mohd Al Qayum Aziz|date=29 May 2010|work=Mstar Online|accessdate=6 April 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100530025621/http://www.mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=%2F2010%2F5%2F29%2Fmstar_hiburan%2F20100528193655&sec=mstar_hiburan|archive-date=30 May 2010|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} and on 11 January 2011, she received two awards from The BrandLaureate – Small and Medium Enterprises Chapter Awards (The BrandLaureate – SME's Chapter Awards), one for her SimplySiti range, for Most Promising Brand and another one for herself, first time introduced in 2011, The BrandLaureate Tun Dr. Siti Hasmah SME's Women of The Year 2010 which was presented by [[Tun Dr Siti Hasmah Mohamad Ali|Tun Dr. Siti Hasmah]], wife of Malaysia's fourth Prime Minister, [[Mahathir Mohamad|Tun Dr. Mahathir]] herself.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza Terima Pengiktirafan BrandLaureate|url=http://www.gua.com.my/hiburan/berita-hangat/Siti_Nurhaliza_Terima_Pengiktirafan_BrandLaureate.html|language=ms|author=SultanMuzaffar|date=12 January 2011|work=Gua.com.my|accessdate=11 February 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110115045635/http://www.gua.com.my/hiburan/berita-hangat/Siti_Nurhaliza_Terima_Pengiktirafan_BrandLaureate.html|archivedate=15 January 2011|df=dmy-all}} She also received Inspiration Woman Award from Association of Malaysian and Indonesian Journalists (ISWAMI) on 29 January.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza terima Anugerah Wanita Inspirasi di Bandung|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2011&dt=0129&pub=Utusan_Malaysia&sec=Terkini&pg=bt_07.htm|language=ms|date=29 January 2011|work=Utusan Online| accessdate = 11 February 2011}} ===SITI, All Your Love and History Channel (2011-2012)=== [[File:Siti Nurhaliza - All Your Love Launching.jpg|thumb|right|250px|Siti Nurhaliza with her husband, Datuk Seri Khalid and her stepson, Adib Khalid at the launching of ''All Your Love''.]] In early 2011, she hosted her own talk show programme, ''SITI'', which with 13 episodes, encompassing four main segments – ''V.I.P. Siti'', ''Sentuhan Kasih (Caring Touch)'', ''Siti's Perspective'' and ''Siti's Symphony'' with the first episode aired on 12 February.{{cite web|title=A chat with Siti|url=http://ecentral.my/news/story.asp?file=/2011/2/11/tvnradio/8031563&sec=tvnradio|author=|date=11 February 2011|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|accessdate=11 February 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120603130131/http://ecentral.my/news/story.asp?file=%2F2011%2F2%2F11%2Ftvnradio%2F8031563&sec=tvnradio|archivedate=3 June 2012|df=dmy-all}} In early March 2011, she announced that she is working on her first full English album, entitled ''[[All Your Love (album)|All Your Love]]''{{cite web|title=Tiba masa Siti|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/69149686?pos=1&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1311586986%3Aresultset|language=ms|author=Abie Abdullah|date=24 July 2011|work=Metro Ahad| accessdate = 25 July 2011}} which was produced by her own stepson's production team What's Up Entertainment, with all the songs written and produced by Australian singers, [[Christian Alexanda]] and Bryan Bouro{{cite web|title=Adib terbit album Inggeris Siti|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/60795820?pos=1&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1299426164%3Aresultset|language=ms|author=Norhadiani Baharom|date=4 March 2011|work=Berita Harian| accessdate = 6 March 2011}} and released on 26 September with her first English single, ''Falling in Love'' debuted at a concert in [[UiTM]] where she also expressed her interest to further her study in that university.{{cite web|title=Selagi ada semangat|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/68338311?pos=1&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1310890002%3Aresultset|language=ms|author=Hanisah Selamat|date=14 July 2011|work=Berita Harian| accessdate = 17 July 2011}} Two out of ten tracks from the album, ''Remember You'' and ''I Wait Forever'' were a duet between her and [[Sean Kingston]] and Christian Alexanda respectively.{{cite web|title=All Your Love Siti bakal jengah Eropah|url=http://www.bharian.com.my/bharian/articles/AllYourLoveSitibakaljengahEropah/Article/index_html|language=ms|author=Zubir Mohd Yunus|date=7 August 2011|work=Berita Harian| accessdate = 7 July 2011}} On 16 July, she won her tenth Regional Most Popular Artiste in a row beating fellow artistes from Malaysia, Indonesia and Singapore, thus setting a new record in the [[Anugerah Planet Muzik]].{{cite web|title=APM 2011: Kali Terakhir Buat Siti Nurhaliza Sertai?|url=http://www.murai.com.my/article/default.asp?article_id=10106&c=1&s=1|language=ms|author=Syafiqah Jalal|date=16 July 2011|work=Murai.com.my|accessdate=17 July 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110719094207/http://www.murai.com.my/article/default.asp?article_id=10106&c=1&s=1|archivedate=19 July 2011|df=dmy-all}} However, this would be her last appearance in the category after the organiser has decided to drop her name from participating in the same category in the future. In September 2011, her company, Siti Nurhaliza Production (SNP) produced her first ever reality singing competition, ''I-Klon'' which was aired in November 2011. The aim of this show is to search for talents that not only can sing but also imitate their idol.{{cite web|title=Dato' Siti Nurhaliza Terbit Program Realiti I-Klon|url=http://www.murai.com.my/article/default.asp?article_id=10528|archive-url=https://archive.is/20130413162520/http://www.murai.com.my/article/default.asp?article_id=10528|dead-url=yes|archive-date=13 April 2013|language=ms|work=Murai.com|publisher=Digital Five Sdn Bhd|accessdate=3 April 2013}} On 17 October, she was reported to be working on her life documentary which was aired on [[History (U.S. TV channel)|History Channel]]{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza Tidak Ambil Mudah|url=http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=/2011/10/17/mstar_hiburan/20111016112345&sec=mstar_hiburan|language=ms|author=Niezam Abdullah|date=17 October 2011|work=mStar|accessdate=21 October 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111019134630/http://www.mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=%2F2011%2F10%2F17%2Fmstar_hiburan%2F20111016112345&sec=mstar_hiburan|archive-date=19 October 2011|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} on 11 January 2012 to coincide with her 33rd birthday.{{cite web|title=Sejarah hidup tanpa memori|url=http://www.kosmo.com.my/kosmo/content.asp?y=2011&dt=1205&pub=Kosmo&sec=Hiburan&pg=hi_01.htm|language=ms|date=17 December 2011|work=Kosmo! Online| accessdate = 6 December 2011}} On 28 January 2012 she received the ''Anugerah Ikon'' (Icon Award) by (APPMH) 2011/12 (Media Hiburan Readers' Choice Awards 2011/12){{cite web|title=Gambar Siti Nurhaliza di Anugerah PPMH 2011/12|url=http://www.budiey.com/gambar-siti-nurhaliza-di-anugerah-ppmh-201112/|language=ms|author=Budiey|date=3 February 2012|work=Sensasi Selebriti| accessdate = 18 February 2013}} and on 8 April, she received a special award, Anugerah Seri Perak from Anugerah Bintang Popular Berita Harian in conjunction with the silver jubilee of the award in April 2012, which she previously had won the ''Anugerah Bintang Paling Popular'' (Most Popular Star Award) for seven times from the same ceremony.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza Terima Anugerah Seri Perak, Aaron Aziz Artis Paling Popular ABPBH2011|url=http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=/2012/4/9/mstar_hiburan/20120409000020&sec=mstar_hiburan|language=ms|author=Mohd Al Qayum Azizi|date=9 April 2012|work=mStar|accessdate=18 February 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120716024815/http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=%2F2012%2F4%2F9%2Fmstar_hiburan%2F20120409000020&sec=mstar_hiburan|archive-date=16 July 2012|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} In April 2012, she accepted an offer to be featured in [[Sami Yusuf]]'s latest album, ''Salaam'' for his song, ''You Came To Me'' which was recorded in three languages, [[Arabic]], [[Malay language|Malay]] and English.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza Berduet Dengan Rockstar Islam, Sami Yusuf|url=http://www.gua.com.my/berita-artis/Siti_Nurhaliza_Berduet_Dengan_Rockstar_Islam_Sami_Yusuf.html|language=ms|author=Nani|date=24 April 2012|work=Gua.com.my|accessdate=5 May 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120427003646/http://www.gua.com.my/berita-artis/Siti_Nurhaliza_Berduet_Dengan_Rockstar_Islam_Sami_Yusuf.html|archivedate=27 April 2012|df=dmy-all}} She also performed the song alongside him for his debut concert in Singapore, 'Konsert Salaam Sami Yusuf' on 8 July. A day later, on 9 July, she was given the chance to perform as the opening act and also the closing ceremonies of the 15th Malaysia Games or [[Sukma Games|SUKMA XV]] on 16 July.{{cite web|title=SUKMA XV dibuka penuh gemilang|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2012&dt=0709&pub=Utusan_Malaysia&sec=Pahang&pg=wp_01.htm|language=ms|author=Mohd. Fairuz Yusof|date=9 July 2012|work=Utusan Online| accessdate = 20 July 2012}}{{cite web|title=Sukan alat perpaduan negara - Najib|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2012&dt=0717&pub=Utusan_Malaysia&sec=Sukan&pg=su_10.htm|language=ms|author=Mohd. Fairuz Yusof|date=17 July 2012|work=Utusan Online| accessdate = 20 July 2012}} Few days earlier, on 5 July, she received another award by EH! magazine for the award of Celebrity with Best Achievements for a second time since 2010.{{cite web|title=Rozita Che Wan Selebriti Paling Seksi 2012|url=http://www.murai.com.my/article/default.asp?article_id=12311&c=30&s=152|language=ms|author=Kheme Rosly|date=5 July 2012|work=Murai.com.my|accessdate=18 February 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121024065122/http://www.murai.com.my/article/default.asp?article_id=12311&c=30&s=152|archivedate=24 October 2012|df=dmy-all}} In September, she announced a new album project with an Indonesian recording company, Virgo Records for Indonesian market where so far a number of Indonesian composers and lyricist have given their songs to Siti, including former lead vocal of [[Kerispatih]], Samuel Simorangkir and [[Dewiq]].{{cite web|title=Penawar Rindu Siti|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/92854424?pos=2&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1352931064%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=6 September 2012|work=Berita Harian| accessdate = 15 November 2012}} The same album will also include a song written by herself and composed by a Malaysian composer, [[Aubrey Suwito]]. In the same month also, she received a special award by Anugerah [[Radio24 (Malaysia)|Radio24 BERNAMA]] (BERNAMA Radio24 Awards) in the category of Entertainment Icon in conjunction with their fifth anniversary.{{cite web|title=5 terima anugerah Bernama Radio24|url=http://www.kosmo.com.my/kosmo/content.asp?y=2012&dt=0930&pub=Kosmo&sec=Negara&pg=ne_08.htm|language=ms|author=Suhana Yusop|date=30 September 2012|work=Kosmo! Online|accessdate = 18 February 2013}} And on 25 November, she was honoured with a special award of Anugerah Kesatria Puteri Kesenian from [[United Malays National Organisation|Puteri UMNO]] in their Himpunan Wanita Muda 2012 (2012 Female Youth Coalition).{{cite web|title=Wartawan Utusan terima anugerah Puteri UMNO|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/Dalam_Negeri/20121126/dn_04/Wartawan-Utusan-terima-anugerah-Puteri-UMNO|language=ms|date=25 November 2012|work=Utusan Online| accessdate = 18 February 2013}} Two weeks earlier, on 11 November, she performed a 2-hour concert at Grand Ballroom, Bukit Gambang Resort City in [[Gambang|Gambang, Pahang]] where it was attended by more than 5000 people including her fans from Indonesia and Singapore and the [[Sultan]] of [[Pahang]], [[Sultan Haji Ahmad Shah]].{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza Persembah Single Baru "Galau" Di Kuantan|url=http://www.gua.com.my/berita-artis/Siti_Nurhaliza_Persembah_Single_Baru_Galau_Di_Kuantan.html|language=ms|date=11 November 2012|work=Gua.com.my|accessdate=15 November 2012|df=dmy-all}} During the concert, she performed her latest single, ''Galau'' which was composed by an Indonesian composer, which will be featured in her latest project with [[Universal Music]].{{cite web|title=Sakit Tak Halang Siti Nurhaliza Hiburkan 5,000 Peminat|url=http://www.murai.com.my/article/default.asp?article_id=13286&c=1&s=1|language=ms|author=Razif Rosdi|date=10 November 2012|work=Gua.com.my|accessdate=15 November 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121114002414/http://www.murai.com.my/article/default.asp?article_id=13286&c=1&s=1|archivedate=14 November 2012|df=dmy-all}} After the concert, she announced that she will be start touring Indonesia from 8 December until 14 December in several major cities, including [[Jakarta]], [[Pekanbaru]] and [[Banjarbaru]].{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza Bersyukur Impiannya Terlaksana|url=http://www.gua.com.my/berita-artis/Siti_Nurhaliza_Bersyukur_Impiannya_Terlaksana.html|language=ms|date=13 November 2012|work=Gua.com.my|accessdate=15 November 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121116004813/http://www.gua.com.my/berita-artis/Siti_Nurhaliza_Bersyukur_Impiannya_Terlaksana.html|archivedate=16 November 2012|df=dmy-all}} However, on 13 December, she has to call off her last destination tour for her husband was involved in a motorcycle accident in New Zealand.{{cite web|title=Suami Kecelakaan, Siti Nurhaliza Batalkan Konser di Banjarmasin|url=http://music.okezone.com/read/2012/12/13/386/731953/suami-kecelakaan-siti-nurhaliza-batalkan-konser-di-banjarmasin|language=id|author=Egie Gusman|date=13 December 2012|work=Music.Okezone.com|accessdate=13 December 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140201162956/http://music.okezone.com/read/2012/12/13/386/731953/suami-kecelakaan-siti-nurhaliza-batalkan-konser-di-banjarmasin|archivedate=1 February 2014|df=dmy-all}} On 13 December also, she was announced as one of the finalists in [[World Music Awards]] 2012 alongside another Malaysian singer, [[Shila Amzah]] in the categories of World's Best Female Artist, World's Best Live Act and World's Best Entertainer of the Year.{{cite web|title=Shila Amzah & Dato' Siti Calon Penyanyi Terbaik Dunia|url=http://mediahiburan.karangkraf.com/memang-hot/shila-amzah-dato-siti-calon-penyanyi-terbaik-dunia-1.112462|language=ms|date=14 December 2012|work=Mediahiburan.karangkraf.com|accessdate=13
