December 2012|df=dmy-all}} However, the awards ceremony was postponed from 22 December 2012 to a later date in 2013, due to logistic and immigration issues.{{cite web|title=World Music Awards postponed due to visa issues, Newtown tragedy|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/287253/showbiz/showbizabroad/world-music-awards-postponed-due-to-visa-issues-newtown-tragedy|date=21 December 2012|work=Showbiz|publisher=GMA Network Inc.}} ===New image, Siti Nurhaliza in Symphony and Konsert Lentera Timur (2013)=== On her 34th birthday, she has made a decision to fully observe the Islamic code of dressing for females by wearing a [[hijab]] at all times even when performing on stage.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza Bertudung Bukan Untuk Berpolitik|url=http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=/2013/2/18/mstar_hiburan/20130217163129&sec=mstar_hiburan|language=ms|author=Mohd Al Qayum Azizi|date=18 February 2013|work=mStar|accessdate=26 March 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130325095939/http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=%2F2013%2F2%2F18%2Fmstar_hiburan%2F20130217163129&sec=mstar_hiburan|archive-date=25 March 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} She also has commented that she will be taking a short break until April to take care of her husband who was involved in an accident in December 2012.{{cite web|title=Siti Lebih Ayu|url=http://www.bharian.com.my/bharian/articles/Sitilebihayu/Article/artikel|language=ms|date=19 March 2013|work=[[Berita Harian]]| accessdate = 26 March 2013}} In the same month, her company, Siti Nurhaliza Productions (SNP) was reported to be working on the second season of ''I-Klon'', a reality singing competition, where it will be aired later this year after its debut in 2011.{{cite web|first=Editorial MH|title=Pencarian Klon Artis Bermula!|url=http://mediahiburan.karangkraf.com/mesti-hibur/pencarian-klon-artis-bermula-1.121839|work=Media Hiburan Online|publisher=Grup Digital Karangkraf|accessdate=3 April 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130327120722/http://mediahiburan.karangkraf.com/mesti-hibur/pencarian-klon-artis-bermula-1.121839|archivedate=27 March 2013|df=dmy-all}} Later, in early February, she debuted her own 13-episode game show, ''Siti Ooo...Som'' where she co-hosted with Nabil Ahmad and Sharifah Shahira. The game show is basically divided into six main segments – ''Sepantas Kilat'', ''Riuh Rendah'', ''Siapa Hebat'', ''Kebaboom'', ''Siti Cabar'' and ''Huru Hara''.{{Cite news|title=Siti Nurhaliza Jadi Pengacara 'Game Show' Pula|url=http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=/2012/12/26/mstar_hiburan/20121225194400|language=ms|date=26 December 2012|work=mStar Online|accessdate=6 February 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140201172032/http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=%2F2012%2F12%2F26%2Fmstar_hiburan%2F20121225194400|archive-date=1 February 2014|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} Also, in the same month, she was revealed to be short listed for the 5th [[Shorty Awards]] in the category of Best Reality Star in Social Media where the winners were announced in New York City on 8 April 2013.{{cite web|title=Announcing the 5th Annual Shorty Awards Vox Populi and Finalists!|url=http://blog.shortyawards.com/post/44093266883/announcing-the-5th-annual-shorty-awards-vox-populi-and|author=Shorty Awards Staff|date=26 February 2013|work=[[Shorty Awards]]|accessdate=26 March 2013}} On 2 March, she won the Bella On-Stage Award, beating other nine contenders in the Bella Awards inauguration event for Malaysian women that have made tremendous achievement in the performing arts.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza beats nine other strong contenders for 'Bella On-Stage Award'|url=http://www.nst.com.my/latest/siti-nurhaliza-beats-nine-other-strong-contenders-for-bella-on-stage-award-1.227553|author=Hizreen Kamal|date=2 March 2013|work=[[New Straits Times]]|accessdate=26 March 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130303020504/http://www.nst.com.my/latest/siti-nurhaliza-beats-nine-other-strong-contenders-for-bella-on-stage-award-1.227553|archivedate=3 March 2013|df=dmy-all}} In the same day, her cosmetic company, [[SimplySiti]] received a recognition from [[Malaysian Book of Records|Malaysia Book of Records]] for the entry of Biggest Participation in Skin Transformation event in One Day.{{cite web|title=Gambar Dato' Siti Nurhaliza di Roadshow Dermagic SimplySiti di Alamanda|url= http://www.budiey.com/gambar-dato-siti-nurhaliza-di-roadshow-dermagic-simplysiti/|author=Budiey|date=2 March 2013|work=SensasiSelebriti.com|accessdate=26 March 2013}} On 7 March, she was chosen to perform in collaboration concert between Malaysia and Indonesia, Konsert Nusantara at [[Istana Budaya]] alongside [[Hafiz (singer)|Hafiz Suip]], [[Rossa (singer)|Rossa]] and few other Malaysian and Indonesian singers.{{cite web|title=Konsert Nusantara di Istana Budaya Mac ini|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/Hiburan/20130221/hi_06/Konsert-Nusantara-di-Istana-Budaya-Mac-ini#.USY6lXXSY_4.twitter|language=ms|date=2 February 2013|work=Utusan Online| accessdate = 26 March 2013}} On 21 March, she was given a chance to perform a duet with [[Babyface (musician)|Kenny Babyface]] through the songs ''[[Fire (Bruce Springsteen song)|Fire]]'' and ''[[When I Fall in Love]]'' for Sapurakencana Petroleum Malaysia Grand Prix Charity Gala 2013 which was attended by various international artists including [[Josh Hartnett]], [[Teri Hatcher]], [[Kimora Lee Simmons]] and many others.{{cite web|title=Kenny Babyface Puji Kelunakan Suara Dato' Siti|url=http://www.murai.com.my/article/default.asp?article_id=14350&c=1&s=1|author=Haswari Ali|date=22 March 2013|work=Murai.com.my|accessdate=26 March 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130323215000/http://www.murai.com.my/article/default.asp?article_id=14350&c=1&s=1|archivedate=23 March 2013|df=dmy-all}}{{cite web|title=Grand prix charity gala raises RM200,000 in aid of heart patients|url=http://thestar.com.my/metro/story.asp?file=/2013/3/23/central/12875998&sec=central|archive-url=https://archive.is/20130413154859/http://thestar.com.my/metro/story.asp?file=/2013/3/23/central/12875998&sec=central|dead-url=yes|archive-date=13 April 2013|author=Choong Mek Zhin|date=23 March 2013|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|accessdate=26 March 2013}} The charity event managed to raise more than RM 200 000 which will be used to aid heart patients. In April, she announced that she will have her first solo concert at the [[Malaysian Philharmonic Orchestra]] for a 3-day concert from 5 to 7 July.{{cite web|title=Siti joins MPO for music showcase|url=http://www.mmail.com.my/story/siti-joins-mpo-music-showcase-54892|date=30 April 2013|work=The Malay Mail|accessdate=12 April 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130502043023/http://www.mmail.com.my/story/siti-joins-mpo-music-showcase-54892|archivedate=2 May 2013|df=dmy-all}} In June, she received a special humanity award from Majlis Perundangan Pertubuhan Islam Malaysia (Mapim), for her effort and support of Mapim's Gaza fundraising.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza terima Anugerah Kemanusiaan Mapim|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/Hiburan/20130629/hi_05/Siti-Nurhaliza-terima-Anugerah-Kemanusiaan-Mapim|language=ms|date=29 June 2013|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 16 June 2013}} On 5 to 7 July, she performed at ''[[Siti Nurhaliza in Symphony|Siti Nurhaliza in Symphony - with the Malaysian Philharmonic Orchestra]]'' at [[Petronas Philharmonic Hall]] for three nights in a row in which tickets were sold out weeks before the said event.{{cite web|title=Utterly Bewitching|url=http://www.thestar.com.my/Lifestyle/Entertainment/Music/News/2013/07/11/Utterly-bewitching.aspx|author=Azhariah Kamin|date=11 July 2013|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]| accessdate = 16 July 2013}} This was her first solo concert at the Petronas Philharmonic Hall where 12 years earlier she was only a guest performer at Tan Sri SM Salim's concert with the Malaysian Philharmonic Orchestra. In August, she received ''Anugerah Artis Wanita Pilihan'' (Favourite Female Artist Award) from the inaugural Anugerah Melodi 2013 during a special Eid episode of Melodi where the winners were chosen entirely by the viewers.{{cite web|title=Anugerah Melodi 2013 - Dato' Siti Nurhaliza Tetap Jadi Pilihan|url=http://www.gua.com.my/berita-artis/Anugerah_Melodi_2013_Dato_Siti_Nurhaliza_Tetap_Jadi_Pilihan.html|language=ms|author=Nani|date=12 August 2013|work=Gua.com.my|accessdate=27 September 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130826235235/http://www.gua.com.my/berita-artis/Anugerah_Melodi_2013_Dato_Siti_Nurhaliza_Tetap_Jadi_Pilihan.html|archivedate=26 August 2013|df=dmy-all}} In the same month, she was also chosen as one of the 'Inspirers' for [[Akademi Fantasia]] 2013 students alongside [[Melly Goeslaw]] and [[Faizal Tahir]] where they will share their experiences as singers and motivate the students in their paths as new artists.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza, Melly Goeslaw & Faizal Tahir Sertai Keluarga AF 2013|url=http://www.malaysiandigest.com/entertainment/425011-siti-nurhaliza-melly-goeslaw-a-faizal-tahir-sertai-keluarga-af-2013.html|language=ms|author=mD Staff|date=22 August 2013|work=MalaysianDigest.com|accessdate=27 September 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130925224944/http://www.malaysiandigest.com/entertainment/425011-siti-nurhaliza-melly-goeslaw-a-faizal-tahir-sertai-keluarga-af-2013.html|archivedate=25 September 2013|df=dmy-all}} In August also, she was chosen among few select Malaysian artists to participate in Konsert 'Harmony and Unity' on 25 August which was held at [[Dataran Merdeka]], alongside few Indonesian artists, including [[Ahmad Dhani]] and [[Rossa (singer)|Rossa]] which was aired on both countries television stations, [[TV1 (Malaysia)|TV1]] and [[Indosiar]] respectively.{{cite web|title=Konsert merdeka Malaysia-Indonesia di Dataran Merdeka Ahad|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/Dalam_Negeri/20130822/dn_48/Konsert-merdeka-Malaysia-Indonesia-di-Dataran-Merdeka-Ahad|language=ms|date=22 August 2013|work=[[Utusan Malaysia|Utusan Online]]|accessdate = 27 September 2013}} In September, she was interviewed by [[National Geographic Channel]] for a special documentary in conjunction with the 50th [[Malaysia Day]], 'Malaysia: Through The Decades' which was aired on 16 September, alongside [[Yuna (singer)|Yuna]], [[Lat]] and Malaysia's first astronaut, [[Sheikh Muszaphar Shukor]] for their insights on Malaysia and what it has achieved over the past 50 years.{{cite web|title=A reflection of Malaysia!|url=http://entertainment.malaysia.msn.com/usercomments/article.aspx?cp-documentid=253779407#page=0|author=MSN Entertainment Malaysia Staff|date=12 September 2013|work=entertainment.malaysia.msn.com/|accessdate = 27 September 2013}} She was also revealed to be nominated in [[Anugerah Planet Muzik]] 2013 at Suntec Convention Hall, Singapore in three different categories - Best Malaysia Song, Best Duo/Group and Regional Most Popular Song which are all shared with [[Hafiz (singer)|Hafiz Suip]] for their collaboration in both artists' single, [[Muara Hati]].{{cite web|title=Senarai Penuh Pencalonan Anugerah Planet Muzik 2013|url=http://www.murai.com.my/article/default.asp?article_id=15673&c=1&s=1|language=ms|date=5 September 2013|work=Murai.com.my|accessdate=27 September 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130928023015/http://www.murai.com.my/article/default.asp?article_id=15673&c=1&s=1|archivedate=28 September 2013|df=dmy-all}} And on 18 October, both of them were revealed to be the winner for two out of three nominations (Best Duo/Group and Regional Most Popular Song).{{cite web|title=Hafiz Menang Besar Di Anugerah Planet Muzik 2013 |url=http://www.gua.com.my/berita-artis/Hafiz_Menang_Besar_Di_Anugerah_Planet_Muzik_2013.html |language=ms |date=19 October 2013 |work=gua.com.my |accessdate=19 October 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131019223401/http://www.gua.com.my/berita-artis/Hafiz_Menang_Besar_Di_Anugerah_Planet_Muzik_2013.html |archivedate=19 October 2013 |df=dmy }} Also, in the same month of September, she held her second major concert in 2013, ''[[Konsert Lentera Timur|Konsert Lentera Timur Dato' Siti Nurhaliza Eksklusif bersama Orkestra Tradisonal Malaysia]]'' at Istana Budaya, which was also her first traditional concert in 18 years of her career.{{cite web|title=Dato' Siti Nurhaliza Janji Yang Terbaik Di Konsert 'Lentera Timur'|url=http://mediahiburan.karangkraf.com/memang-hot/dato-siti-nurhaliza-janji-yang-terbaik-di-konsert-lentera-timur-1.196988|language=ms|author=MH Staff|date=30 August 2013|work=mediahiburan.karangkraf.com|accessdate=27 September 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131029192337/http://mediahiburan.karangkraf.com/memang-hot/dato-siti-nurhaliza-janji-yang-terbaik-di-konsert-lentera-timur-1.196988|archivedate=29 October 2013|df=dmy-all}} Backed by 40 musicians from Orkestra Tradisional Malaysia, with 35 different traditional songs, ranging from [[Zapin]], Samrah, [[Keroncong]], [[Joget]] to few other traditional genres, the 2-hour concert was tentatively planned to be only for three days in a row from 20 to 22 September, before the fourth day, which is 24 September was added after receiving high demands from her fans and fans of traditional music to add another date to the 3-day concert.{{cite web|title=Ulasan Konsert Lentera Timur Dato' Siti Nurhaliza|url=http://www.budiey.com/ulasan-konsert-lentera-timur-dato-siti-nurhaliza/|language=ms|author=Budiey|date=21 August 2013|work=Budiey.com|accessdate = 27 September 2013}} On 27 October, the concert was revealed as the most successful solo concert ever held at Istana Budaya, where it managed to collect more than RM 900 000.{{cite web|title="Konsert Lantera Timur" Siti Nurhaliza catat rekod Istana Budaya|url=http://www.astroawani.com/news/show/konsert-lantera-timur-siti-nurhaliza-catat-rekod-istana-budaya-24605|language=ms|author=Astro Awani Staff|date=27 October 2013|work=[[Astro Awani]]|accessdate = 27 October 2013}} In late November and December 2013, she was invited to perform for two international events. On 28 November, she was in Japan after receiving an invitation by the Japanese embassy in Malaysia for Asean-Japan Music Festival - Music for Healing after the Earthquake in commemoration of the 40th anniversary of Japan - Asean countries relationship,{{cite web|title=Siti wakil negara ke Jepun|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/Hiburan/20131121/hi_09/Siti-wakil-negara-ke-Jepun|language=ms|date=21 November 2013|work=Utusan Online| accessdate = 30 December 2013}} and as a musical appeal for relief aids for victims of [[2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami]].{{cite web|title=Christian Bautista hopes to appeal for more relief aid in music fest|url=http://entertainment.inquirer.net/122297/christian-bautista-hopes-to-appeal-for-more-relief-aid-in-music-fest|author=Policarpio, Allan|date=24 November 2013|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|accessdate = 30 December 2013}} During the festival, she performed a medley of songs that she personally had chosen - ''[[Biarlah Rahsia]]'', ''Koibito yo'' (a Japanese song, made famous by [[Mayumi Itsuwa]]) and ''Nirmala'' in front of other representatives from both Japan and Asean countries and also the Japanese Prime Minister, [[Shinzō Abe]] who officiated the festival.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza wakil negara ke Festival Muzik Asean-Jepun|url=http://www.astroawani.com/news/show/siti-nurhaliza-wakil-negara-ke-festival-muzik-asean-jepun-25732|language=ms|author=Astro Awani Staff|date=20 November 2013|work=[[Astro Awani]]|accessdate = 30 December 2013}} Apart from local Japanese viewing, the festival was also made available for viewing for worldwide audience through [[NHK World]]. On 5 December, she was invited to perform at the 2013 [[Asian Television Awards]] at Resorts World Sentosa, Singapore, where she performed two songs - "[[Lebih Indah]]" and "[[On the Floor]]"{{cite web|title=Award Winning Antics: 18th Asian Television Awards|url=http://www.tnp.sg/backstage/content/award-winning-antics-18th-asian-television-awards|author=Tan Kee Yun|date=5 December 2013|work=[[The New Paper]]|accessdate=30 December 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131230233532/http://www.tnp.sg/backstage/content/award-winning-antics-18th-asian-television-awards|archivedate=30 December 2013|df=dmy-all}} where the show was broadcast for the first time to both [[STAR World]] and [[Channel V]] reaching audiences in Hong Kong, Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand and Vietnam.{{cite web|title=Asian Television Awards to be televised on Star World and Channel [V]|url=http://www.onscreenasia.com/article/asian-television-awards-to-be-televised-on-star-world-and-channel-v/13502#.Up87I0xO_p4.twitter|author=Shreya Gopi|date=19 November 2013|work=OnScreenAsia.com|accessdate=30 December 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131230232644/http://www.onscreenasia.com/article/asian-television-awards-to-be-televised-on-star-world-and-channel-v/13502#.Up87I0xO_p4.twitter|archivedate=30 December 2013|df=dmy-all}} ===Where the Heart Is and Live in Singapore concerts, Icon of Malaysia and Fragmen (2014)=== [[File:Siti Nurhaliza and David Foster - David Foster and Friends.jpg|thumb|right|350px|Siti Nurhaliza performing [[I Will Always Love You#Whitney Houston version|I Will Always Love You]] with [[David Foster]] during his "David Foster and Friends" concert, in conjunction with "Sapurakencana Petroleum Malaysia Grand Prix Gala Dinner & Concert 2014" on 27 March.]] On 6 January,{{cite web|title=Konsert Dato Siti Nurhaliza Live in KLCC Where The Heart Is|url=http://www.budiey.com/dato-siti-nurhaliza-live-klcc-heart/|author=Budiey|date=6 January 2014|work=Budiey.com|accessdate=18 April 2014}} she announced the dates for her first charity concert, where proceeds will be channelled to her own charity organisation, ''Yayasan Nurjiwa'' (Nurjiwa Foundation), where it will provide aid to those who are in needs.{{Cite news|title=An intimate encounter with Siti Nurhaliza|url=http://www.thestar.com.my/Lifestyle/Entertainment/Music/News/2014/02/10/An-intimate-encounter-with-Siti-Nurhaliza/|author=Kenneth Chaw|date=10 February 2014|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]| accessdate=18 April 2014}} Named "Dato Siti Nurhaliza Live in Concert - Where the Heart is", the two-hour concert was held on two consecutive nights, 8 and 9 February at Plenary Hall, [[Kuala Lumpur Convention Centre]].{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza Sasar Kutip RM4 Juta Untuk Kebajikan|url=http://www.mstar.com.my/artikel/?file=/2014/1/7/mstar_hiburan/20140106193807|language=ms|author=Mohd Al Qayum Azizi|date=7 January 2014|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|Mstar]]|accessdate=18 April 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140715062345/http://www.mstar.com.my/artikel/?file=%2F2014%2F1%2F7%2Fmstar_hiburan%2F20140106193807|archive-date=15 July 2014|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} On 9 February, it was revealed that the two-day concert managed to reach its goal by grossing more than RM 1 million, from ticket sales and donations from philanthropists alone.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza berjaya kumpul dana RM1 juta|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/Dalam_Negeri/20140210/dn_17/Siti-Nurhaliza-berjaya-kumpul-dana-RM1-juta|language=ms|author=Tengku Khalidah Tengku Bidin|date=10 February 2014|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 18 April 2014}} In February, she announced a collaboration with Artelier Gallery Kuala Lumpur, in her continuous 2014 effort to raise funds for her foundation.{{cite web|title=""SITI: An Iconic Exhibition of Dato Siti Nurhaliza", ilham penggiat seni baru|url=http://www.astroawani.com/news/show/siti-an-iconic-exhibition-of-dato-siti-nurhaliza-ilham-penggiat-seni-baru-30368|language=ms|author=Muzaffar Mustafa|date=19 February 2014|work=[[Astro Awani]]|accessdate = 19 April 2014}} With participation from 15 Malaysian, one Spanish and one Iranian painters, "[[SITI: An Iconic Exhibition of Dato’ Siti Nurhaliza]]" was an exhibition of artworks and sculptures by the 17 painters and artists - their takes on how Siti Nurhaliza has inspired them.{{cite web|title=Lukisan Wajah Siti Nurhaliza Dijual Sehingga RM75,000|url=http://www.mstar.com.my/hiburan/berita-hiburan/2014/02/28/siti-nurhaliza-lukisan/|language=ms|author=Feride Hikmet Atak|date=28 February 2014|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|Mstar]]| accessdate = 18 April 2014}} A month before the exhibition, every single painter and sculpture artist was given the opportunity to personally interview Siti before proceeding with producing their artworks based on their preferred materials and styles. The exhibition was opened from 27 February until 26 March.{{cite web|title=Pameran Lukisan Ikonik Dato' Siti Nurhaliza|url=http://www.murai.com.my/berita/tempatan/article/articleid/455034/pameran-lukisan-ikonik-dato-siti-nurhaliza|language=ms|date=21 February 2014|work=Murai.com.my|accessdate=19 April 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140409212037/http://murai.com.my/berita/tempatan/article/articleid/455034/pameran-lukisan-ikonik-dato-siti-nurhaliza|archivedate=9 April 2014|df=dmy-all}} All the artworks were up for sale, where 30 percent of total grossed sale will be channelled to ''Yayasan Nurjiwa''. The highest price goes to finger painting made by the Spanish painter, Andrian Torres, priced at RM 75 000. Also, in February,{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza returns for solo concert in Singapore after six-year absence|url=https://sg.entertainment.yahoo.com/blogs/singapore-showbiz/siti-nurhaliza-returns-solo-concert-singapore-six-absence-072800193.html|author=Jeff Oon|date=21 February 2014|work=[[Yahoo! News|Yahoo! Entertainment Singapore]]|accessdate=10 June 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140715045133/https://sg.entertainment.yahoo.com/blogs/singapore-showbiz/siti-nurhaliza-returns-solo-concert-singapore-six-absence-072800193.html|archivedate=15 July 2014|df=dmy-all}} she announced her first concert in Singapore which was performed on 12 April at The Star Theater after a six-year absence since her last solo concert in Singapore in 2008.{{cite web|title=Siti to sing Singapore songs|url=http://news.asiaone.com/news/showbiz/siti-sing-singapore-songs|author=Eddino Abdul Hadi|date=5 April 2014|work=[[The New Paper]]|accessdate = 10 June 2014}} The one-day concert, billed as "Dato' Siti Nurhaliza - Live in Singapore" received positive reviews from local concert reviewers.{{cite web|title=Dato' Siti Nurhaliza live in Singapore - 3.5/5|url=http://www.todayonline.com/entertainment/dato-siti-nurhaliza-live-singapore-355|author=Naadiah Bte Mohamad Munir Badib|date=14 April 2014|work=[[Today (Singapore newspaper)|Today]]|accessdate = 10 June 2014}}{{cite web|title=Siti gets cheeky |url=http://news.asiaone.com/news/showbiz/siti-gets-cheeky?page=0%2C0|author=Juliane June Rasul|date=16 April 2014|work=[[The New Paper]]|accessdate = 10 June 2014}} One of the reviewers praised her ability to sound "flawless" while both singing and dancing at the same time. Apart from the announcement of the concert in Singapore, also in the same month,{{cite web|title=Dato' Siti Nurhaliza Bakal Berkongsi Pentas Dengan David Foster|url=http://www.budiey.com/dato-siti-nurhaliza-bakal-berkongsi-pentas-dengan-david-foster/|author=Budiey|date=17 February 2014|work=www.budiey.com|accessdate = 11 June 2014}} it was revealed that she was chosen by [[David Foster]] as one of the guest artists in a one-night only "David Foster and Friends" show that was originally scheduled as the major event of Sapurakencana Petroleum Malaysia Grand Prix Gala Dinner & Concert 2014 on 27 March.{{cite web|title=Q&A: David Foster, award-winning record producer and composer|url=http://www.lifestyleasia.com/all/en/style/feature/qa-david-foster/|author=Keirsten Clark|date=25 March 2014|work=Lifestyle Asia|accessdate=11 June 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714231901/http://www.lifestyleasia.com/all/en/style/feature/qa-david-foster/|archivedate=14 July 2014|df=dmy-all}} However, due to the date's proximity to the [[Malaysia Airlines Flight 370]] incident, the entire show was later revamped to become a full-fledged tribute concert.{{cite web|title=Tragedi MH370, tiga konsert berskala besar dibatalkan|url=http://www.kosmo.com.my/kosmo/content.asp?y=2014&dt=0327&pub=Kosmo&sec=Hiburan&pg=hi_04.htm|language=ms|date=27 March 2014|work=[[Kosmo!]]|accessdate = 11 June 2014}} During the night of the show, she was accompanied by Foster on piano to perform two songs that Foster originally produced - [[I Will Always Love You#Whitney Houston version|I Will Always Love You]] and [[Because You Loved Me]].{{cite web|title=Vince, Elvira pukau Foster|url=http://www.hmetro.com.my/myMetro/articles/Vince_ElvirapukauFoster/Article/index_html|language=ms|date=30 March 2014|work=[[Harian Metro]]|accessdate = 11 June 2014}} Foster also accompanied Siti to Siti's own single, ''Seindah Biasa''. In April, she was honoured by [[Malaysian Book of Records|Malaysia Book of Records]] as one of the recipients of "Icon of Malaysia".{{cite web|title=High achievers receive MBR Award 2014 from Najib|url=http://english.astroawani.com/news/show/high-achievers-receive-mbr-award-2014-from-najib-35013|author=Astro Awani Staff|date=1 May 2014|work=[[Astro Awani]]|accessdate = 1 June 2014}}{{cite web|title=Prime Minister pays tribute to record holders at Malaysia Book of Records event |url=http://www.thestar.com.my/News/Nation/2014/04/30/Malaysia-Book-of-Records-event/|author=Allan Koay and Hemananthani Sivanandam|date=30 April 2014|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]| accessdate = 11 June 2014}} The same award was also conferred to other Malaysians who have achieved success in their respective fields - [[Jimmy Choo|Dato' Jimmy Choo]], [[Sheikh Muszaphar Shukor|Datuk Dr. Sheikh Muszaphar Shukor]] and [[Tony Fernandes|Tan Sri Tony Fernandes]]. On 30 June, she released her sixteenth solo album, ''[[Fragmen]]'' which was certified as Platinum, after more than 10 000 copies were shipped in less than two months.{{cite web|title=Hikmah sebalik musibah |url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/131224411?pos=1&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1409163764%3Aresultset |language=ms |author=Farihad Shalla Mahmud |date=27 August 2014 |work=[[Berita Harian|Berita Minggu]] |accessdate=28 August 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140903103503/http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/131224411?pos=1&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww%2Fcross-search%2Fsearch.php%3A_1409163764%3Aresultset |archivedate=3 September 2014 |df=dmy }} Two months later, on 17 October, ''Fragmen'' enabled Siti to win two awards from 2014 Anugerah Planet Muzik in the category of Best Female Artiste and Best Song (Malaysia) for "Lebih Indah".{{cite web|title=APM 2014: Siti Nurhaliza dinobat Penyanyi Wanita Terbaik|url=http://www.astroawani.com/news/show/apm-2014-siti-nurhaliza-dinobat-penyanyi-wanita-terbaik-46442|language=ms|author=Astro Awani Staff|date=18 October 2014|work=[[Astro Awani]]|accessdate= 30 November 2014}} On 21 October, the Indonesian version of ''Fragmen'' was officially launched and released at Artotel, [[Central Jakarta]] with an additional track, a duet with [[Cakra Khan]], "[[Seluruh Cinta]]".{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza Rilis Album di Indonesia|url=http://hiburan.metrotvnews.com/read/2014/10/22/308419/siti-nurhaliza-rilis-album-di-indonesia|language=id|author=Agustinus Shindu Alpito|work=[[MetroTV]]|accessdate=1 December 2014}} She also embarked on a 5-day promotional trip to Indonesia, where she participated in various Indonesian entertainment programs including on [[MNCTV]],{{cite AV media|date=20 October 2014|people=Hannie Susanti (Producer) & Gerryndra Danurwendo (Producer)|title=Persembahan Cinta 23|medium=Motion Picture|language=Indonesian|publisher=[[MNCTV]]|location=Indonesia}} [[RCTI]],{{cite AV media|date=21 October 2014|people=Armen E. Basauli (Producer)|title=dahSyat|medium=Motion Picture|language=Indonesian|publisher=[[RCTI]]|location=Indonesia}} [[Global TV (Indonesia)|Global TV]],{{cite AV media|date=22 October 2014|people=Pramudito Joedojo (Producer)|title=Persembahan Cinta 23|medium=Motion Picture|language=Indonesian|publisher=[[Global TV (Indonesia)|Global TV]]|location=Indonesia}} [[NET.]]{{cite AV media|date=1 November 2014|people=Wishnutama (Director)|title=Sarah Sechan|medium=Motion Picture|language=Indonesian|publisher=[[NET.]]|location=Indonesia}} and [[SCTV (Indonesia)|SCTV]].{{cite AV media|date=21 October 2014|people=Dini Putri (Director), Tiruma Imelda (Producer) & Jahja I. Rianto (Executive Producer)|title=Inbox|medium=Motion Picture|language=Indonesian|publisher=[[SCTV (Indonesia)|SCTV]]|location=Indonesia}} In November she won three different awards — "National Icon" from Inaugural Malaysia Women Of Excellence Awards 2014 on 10 November,{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza terima dua anugerah|url=http://www.bharian.com.my/node/16916|language=ms|author=Zaidi Mohamad|date=11 November 2014|work=[[Berita Harian]]|accessdate= 30 November 2014}}{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza talks about album sales, AIM nominations and her 20 years in show business|url=http://www.thestar.com.my/Lifestyle/People/2014/11/20/Catching-up-with-Siti-Nurhaliza/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141120141841/http://www.thestar.com.my/Lifestyle/People/2014/11/20/Catching-up-with-Siti-Nurhaliza/|dead-url=yes|archive-date=20 November 2014|author=Kenneth Shaw|date=20 November 2014|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|accessdate=20 November 2014}} "Jewel of Muslim World" award from the Jewels Of Muslim World Awards 2014 on 11 November and "Asian Music Legend" award from 2014 Top Asia Corporate Ball on 22 November.{{cite web|title=Malaysia Bolot 2 Anugerah Pada Top Asia Corporate Ball 2014|url=http://www.bernama.com/bernama/v7/bm/bu/newsbusiness.php?id=1088702|language=ms|author=Bernama Staff|date=26 November 2014|work=[[Bernama]]|accessdate= 30 November 2014}} On 6 December, she won three awards out of eight nominations that she received from 2014 Anugerah Industri Muzik in the category of Best Album Recording for the album ''Konsert Lentera Timur (Dato' Siti Nurhaliza Bersama Orkestra Tradisional Malaysia)'', Best Vocal Performance in a Song (Female) for "Lebih Indah" and Best Album for ''Fragmen''.{{cite news|last1=Norimy Aimi |title=Datuk Siti Nurhaliza Kuasai AIM 21 |language=ms |url=http://www.manggaonline.com.my/datuk-siti-nurhaliza-kuasai-aim-21/ |accessdate=6 December 2014 |work=Mangga Online |publisher=Utusan Karya Sdn Bhd |date=7 December 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141209153008/http://www.manggaonline.com.my/datuk-siti-nurhaliza-kuasai-aim-21/ |archivedate=9 December 2014 |df=dmy }} Her winning for "Lebih Indah" marked the twelfth time she wins the category since she joined the Malaysian music industry.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza Rangkul Vokal Terbaik AIM Buat Kali Ke-12|url=http://www.rotikaya.com/siti-nurhaliza-terima-anugerah-vokal-terbaik-aim-buat-kali-ke-12/|language=ms|author=RotiKaya Staff|date=7 December 2014|work=RotiKaya.com|accessdate = 8 December 2014}} On 18 December, she is one of the recipients of Anugerah Srikandi Negara from Peninsular Malay Students Federation (GPMS).{{cite web|title=Siti Hasmah honoured by students group she helped found in 1948|url=http://www.thestar.com.my/News/Nation/2014/12/18/Siti-Hasmah-receives-Srikandi-negara-award/|author=P. Aruna|date=18 December 2014|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]| accessdate = 29 December 2014}} Less than a week later, on 24 December, she was announced as the winner for three awards from [[2014 World Music Awards]] - World's Best Female Malay Artist, World's Best Malay Live Act and World's Best Malay Entertainer.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza, Winner of the World's Best Malay Female Artist Award, Best Malay Live Act & Best Malay Entertainer|url=https://www.facebook.com/worldmusicawards/photos/a.641191275961989.1073741848.305202169560903/744081459006303/?type=1&theater|author=[[World Music Awards]]' Admin|date=24 December 2014|accessdate = 29 December 2014}} ===''Unplugged'' and Konsert Satu Suara, Vol. 2 (2015)=== [[File:Siti Nurhaliza - Mahligai Permata & Ya Maulai (Anugerah MeleTOP ERA 2015).webm|270px|left|thumb|thumbtime=6:41|Closing performance by Siti for Anugerah MeleTOP ERA 2015 on 22 February 2015.]] During the [[New Year's Eve]] of 2015, she was in Singapore as one of the guest artists for the countdown of [[Golden jubilee#In Singapore|Celebrate SG50]], which marked Singapore's 50 years of independence.{{cite web|title=BigBang start to new year at Celebrate SG50 countdown party|url=http://www.straitstimes.com/lifestyle/bigbang-start-to-new-year-at-celebrate-sg50-countdown-party|author=Rebecca Lynne Tan|date= 2 January 2015|work=[[Straits Times]]|accessdate = 1 January 2016}} 2015 also marked her twentieth year in the Malaysian entertainment industry since she won 1995 RTM Bintang HMI singing competition.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza selepas dua dasawarsa|trans-title=Siti Nurhaliza after 2 Decades|url=http://kosmo.com.my/kosmo/content.asp?y=2015&dt=0329&pub=Kosmo&sec=Hiburan&pg=hi_01.htm|language=ms|author=Najiy Jefri|date= 29 March 2015|work=[[Kosmo!]]|accessdate = 1 January 2016}} To celebrate the anniversary, a special one night only acoustic concert was planned and organized on 7 April 2015 at [[Istana Budaya]]. Titled [[Dato' Siti Nurhaliza Unplugged 2015]], tickets for the concert sold out days before the concert date and her vocal performances and overall concert received positive reviews from reviewers and critics alike.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza terus lengkapkan portfolio (Siti Nurhaliza Continues Completing Portfolio)|url=http://bm.therakyatpost.com/buzz/2015/04/08/siti-nurhaliza-terus-lengkapkan-portfolio/|language=ms|author=Shazryn Mohd Faizal|date=April 8, 2015|work=The Rakyat Post|accessdate = 1 January 2015}}{{cite web|title=Dato’ Siti Nurhaliza Semakin Petah Berjenaka Di Pentas (Dato' Siti Nurhaliza is Getting Better to Banter on Stage)|url=http://www.murai.com.my/reviu/pentas/article/articleid/661317/dato-siti-nurhaliza-semakin-petah-berjenaka-di-pentas|language=ms|author=Murai Staff|date=9 April 2015|work=Murai.com.my|accessdate=1 January 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150711232127/http://www.murai.com.my/reviu/pentas/article/articleid/661317/dato-siti-nurhaliza-semakin-petah-berjenaka-di-pentas|archivedate=11 July 2015|df=dmy-all}} Present in the concert were people who have helped her throughout the years including her former mentor, [[Adnan Abu Hassan]] and former [[Prime Minister of Malaysia]], [[Mahathir Mohamad|Tun Dr. Mahathir Mohamad]].{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza Dedah Kisah Lalu Dalam Konsert Unplugged 2015 (Siti Nurhaliza Revealed Past Experiences in "Konsert Unplugged 2015")|url=http://www.mstar.com.my/hiburan/berita-hiburan/2015/04/08/siti-nurhaliza-konsert/|language=ms|author=Kemalia Othman|date=8 April 2015|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|mStar]]|accessdate = 1 January 2016}} Two months later, the concert was released in multiple formats including CD and DVD{{cite web|title=Album ‘Unplugged’ beri signifikan tersendiri buat Siti Nurhaliza|trans-title=The 'Unplugged' album has its own significant to Siti Nurhaliza|url=http://bm.therakyatpost.com/buzz/2015/07/02/album-unplugged-beri-signifikan-tersendiri-buat-siti-nurhaliza/|language=ms|author=Shazryn Mohd Faizal|date= 2 July 2015|work=The Rakyat Post|accessdate = 1 January 2016}} with three additional tracks accompanying the CD release of the ''[[Unplugged (Siti Nurhaliza album)|Unplugged]]'' album. In conjunction with her twentieth year in the industry, a special tribute song was gifted to her by [[Era FM]] and Raku (a radio station subsidiary of [[Astro (television)|Astro]]).{{cite web|title=Inspirasi hadiah terbaik untuk Siti|trans-title="Inspirasi" as the best gift for Siti|url=http://www.hmetro.com.my/node/72007|language=ms|author=Nor Akmar Samudin|date=21 August 2015|work=[[Harian Metro]]|accessdate = 2 January 2016}} Titled "Inspirasi" (Inspiration), it was composed by [[Faizal Tahir]] and sung by him and [[Hafiz (singer)|Hafiz Suip]]. [[File:Siti Nurhaliza - Siti Nurhaliza Komen Desas-Desus Kehamilan.webm|270px|thumb|right|thumbtime=0:34|A news report by MeleTOP on 11 November that covers both [[Konsert Satu Suara, Vol. 2]] and her pregnancy rumours.]] In August, she recorded and performed "[[Maryan (soundtrack)|Nenjae Ezhu]]", a song composed by [[A. R. Rahman]] - her first Tamil song for the opening performance of International Superstar 2015, an international Indian singing competition.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza records Tamil song composed by AR Rahman (VIDEO)|url=http://www.themalaymailonline.com/showbiz/article/siti-records-tamil-song-composed-by-ar-rahman-video|author=Malay Mail Staff|date=5 August 2015|work=[[Malay Mail]]|accessdate = 2 January 2016}} In October, Siti was inducted in the 2016 edition of [[The 500 Most Influential Muslims]].{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza named among 500 most influential Muslims|url=http://www.thestar.com.my/news/in-other-media/2015/10/05/siti-nurhaliza-500-most-influential-muslims/|author=The Star Staff|date=21 August 2015|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|accessdate = 2 January 2016}} In the same month in Singapore, she shared an award with Cakra Khan from Indonesia in the category of Best Collaboration (Artiste) for their duet, "[[Seluruh Cinta]]" from the 2015 installment of [[Anugerah Planet Muzik]].{{cite web|title=Taufik Batisah Ungguli Anugerah Planet Muzik 2015|trans-title=Taufik Batisah Leads Anugerah Planet Muzik 2015|url=http://www.murai.com.my/berita/tempatan/article/articleid/702683/taufik-batisah-ungguli-anugerah-planet-muzik-2015|language=ms|author=Kamaruddin Razal|date=10 October 2015|work=Murai.com.my|accessdate=2 January 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160126102445/http://www.murai.com.my/berita/tempatan/article/articleid/702683/taufik-batisah-ungguli-anugerah-planet-muzik-2015|archivedate=26 January 2016|df=dmy-all}} In the following month, she embarked on her second concert at [[Istana Budaya]] in 2015 on 7 and 8 November with [[Konsert Satu Suara, Vol. 2]].{{cite web|title=Siti, Rossa paling cemerlang di Istana Budaya|trans-title=Siti, Rossa [are] the most successful at Istana Budaya|url=http://www.bharian.com.my/node/109883|language=ms|author=Rozdan Mazalan|date=31 December 2015|work=[[Berita Harian]]|accessdate = 2 January 2016}} Accompanied by [[Hetty Koes Endang]] (Indonesia) and [[Ramli Sarip]] (Singapore), the two-day concert was a commercial success, managing to collect more than RM 650 000 from tickets alone. During the two-day concert, rumours of her pregnancy arose.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza hamil?|trans-title=Siti Nurhaliza is pregnant?|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/berita/nasional/siti-nurhaliza-hamil-1.156496|language=ms|author=Tengku Khalidah Tengku Bidin|date=9 November 2015|work=[[Utusan Malaysia]]|accessdate = 2 January 2016}} While she refused to approve or disprove the rumours, she finally revealed on her personal [[Instagram]] account on 1 December that she suffered a miscarriage after two months of pregnancy.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza shares devastating news of miscarriage|url=http://www.star2.com/people/2015/12/01/siti-nurhaliza-shares-devastating-news-of-miscarriage/|author=Kenneth Chaw|date=1 December 2015|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|accessdate = 2 January 2016}} She commented in the post, "I don't want to deny the news of my pregnancy as this was a beautiful gift that I have been waiting for a long time...This gift was too new and fragile, I was just waiting for the right time". On the same day, she was revealed to be one of the top Asian artists in Malaysia on [[Spotify]]'s annual Year in Music list.{{cite web|title=Ed Sheeran, Jay Chou are Spotify’s most streamed artists in Malaysia|url=http://www.themalaysianinsider.com/showbiz/article/ed-sheeran-jay-chou-are-spotifys-most-streamed-artists-in-malaysia#sthash.goxzVryi.dpuf|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151215073415/http://www.themalaysianinsider.com/showbiz/article/ed-sheeran-jay-chou-are-spotifys-most-streamed-artists-in-malaysia#sthash.goxzVryi.dpuf|dead-url=yes|archive-date=15 December 2015|author=The Malaysian Insider Staff|date=1 December 2015|work=[[The Malaysian Insider]]|accessdate=2 January 2016}} In the same month, she was invited to Indonesia as a guest judge for the Top 8 of Dangdut Academy Asia (D'Academy Asia),{{cite web|title=Duet Apik Siti Nurhaliza dan Hetty Koes Endang di D'Academy Asia|trans-title=A Great Duet between Siti Nurhaliza and Hetty Koes Endang on D'Academy Asia|url=http://www.bintang.com/music/read/2394751/duet-apik-siti-nurhaliza-dan-hetty-koes-endang-di-dacademy-asia|language=id|author=Putu Elmira|date=21 December 2015|work=Bintang.com|accessdate = 2 January 2016}} a [[Nusantara]]-wide [[dangdut]] singing competition featuring contestants from Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore and Brunei.{{cite web|title=Memetakan Kekuatan Peserta D' Academy Asia dari 4 Negara|trans-title=Mapping the Strength of D'Academy Asia Contestants|url=http://showbiz.liputan6.com/read/2367792/memetakan-kekuatan-peserta-d-academy-asia-dari-4-negara|language=id|author=Puji Astuti HPS|date=17 November 2015|work=[[Liputan 6]]|accessdate = 2 January 2016}} ==Artistry== ===Influences=== Growing up as a child, most of her time, she would perform traditional and classic Malay folk songs. However, she has been cited that her local idol and one of her greatest influences is [[Sudirman Arshad]]{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza... pamer kehebatan beraksi di konsert|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=1999&dt=1101&pub=utusan_malaysia&sec=Hiburan&pg=et_01.htm&arc=hive|language=ms|date=1 November 1999|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 13 September 2010}} and also [[P. Ramlee]] whereas, her international idols would be [[Barbra Streisand]],{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza , Malaysia's pop princess|url=http://www.thingsasian.com/stories-photos/3260|date=4 March 2005|work=Things Asian – Experience Asia Through the Eyes of Travelers|accessdate = 18 January 2010}} [[Celine Dion]], [[Mariah Carey]]{{cite web|title=Peransang Abang Dalam Karier Siti Nurhaliza|url=http://www.simplysiti.com/peransang-abang-dalam-karier-siti-nurhaliza/|language=ms|work=Simply Siti Nurhaliza Zone|accessdate = 25 January 2010}} and [[Whitney Houston]]. In 2008, during Cèline Dion's [[Taking Chances Tour]] in Malaysia, Siti was given an opportunity to meet her idol,{{cite web|title=Celine Peramah, Saida Pemalu – Siti|url=http://www.murai.com.my/photo/default.asp?media_id=2331&article_id=1080&c=1&s=1|language=ms|date=15 April 2008|work=Murai.com.my|accessdate=18 January 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080925192915/http://www.murai.com.my/photo/default.asp?media_id=2331&article_id=1080&c=1&s=1|archivedate=25 September 2008|df=dmy-all}} where she also had given Cèline one of her solo albums, ''Hadiah Daripada Hati'' complete with her signature.{{cite web|title=Akhirnya Siti bertemu Celine Dion|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2008&dt=0415&pub=utusan_malaysia&sec=Hiburan&pg=hi_05.htm&arc=hive|language=ms|author=Saharudin Musthafa|date=15 April 2008|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 13 September 2010}} ===Image and legacy=== {{Double image|right|Aizat Amdan - Anugerah Juara Lagu Ke-23.jpg|343|Miss Malaysia 2008 Soo Wincci.jpg|142|[[Aizat Amdan]] (''left'') and [[Soo Wincci]] (''right'') are said to be influenced by Siti.}} When she made her debut into the industry, she was often labelled as a ''penyanyi kampung''{{cite web|title=Evolusi Siti|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/4333546?pos=57&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1281969466%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=26 November 2006|work=Metro Ahad|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Text Archive|accessdate = 16 August 2010}} (old-fashioned or conservative singer) for her modest attire and her refusal to take pictures with a man for a magazine cover, unless at a ceremony or at an award-accepting event.{{cite web|title=Hormatilah Prinsip Saya.|url=http://www.simplysiti.com/1997/05/26/hormatilah-prinsip-saya/|language=ms|date=26 March 1997|work=Utusan Online|publisher=Simply Siti Nurhaliza Zone|accessdate=17 August 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071110042152/http://simplysiti.com/1997/05/26/hormatilah-prinsip-saya/|archivedate=10 November 2007|df=dmy-all}} During her early years as a singer, she was criticised for refusing to wear daring clothes and her principle of not taking pictures with male artistes.{{cite web|title=Populariti…Bukan Terletak Pada Gaya Seksi.|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=1998&dt=1026&pub=utusan_malaysia&sec=Hiburan&pg=et_01.htm&arc=hive|language=ms|date=26 October 1998|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 17 August 2010}}{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza Artis Yang Wajar Menjadi Contoh.|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=1998&dt=1125&pub=utusan_malaysia&sec=Hiburan&pg=et_01.htm&arc=hive|language=ms|date=25 November 1998|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 17 August 2010}} She was quoted as saying: "As an artist, I do realize that there are many social responsibilities that I need to take care of. So, I opt to be moderate in everything, including in my sartorial matter." and "I want to show what my talent is, and my God-gifted vocal ability without relying [on the image] of being sexy.". Her debut in Indonesia in 1997 with modest, beautiful and talented personality has said to revolutionise Indonesian music industry which famous with [[Dangdut]] which before this promoted sensual and erotic elements through the performances, especially those by female artistes.{{cite web|title=Bukti kehebatan artis kita|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/1216513?pos=28&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1281969466%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=21 July 2009|work=Harian Metro|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Text Archive|accessdate = 16 August 2010}} Her modest image was the subject of appraisals and positive feedback even from the Islamic scholars from Malaysia and Indonesia.{{cite web|title=TERUSKAN LAGI SITI!|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/45796245?pos=1&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1281969466%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=25 January 2005|work=Harian Metro|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Text Archive|accessdate = 16 August 2010}}{{cite web|title=SITI TERHARU (HL)|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/45794269?pos=2&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1281969466%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=24 January 2005|work=Harian Metro|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Text Archive|accessdate = 16 August 2010}} Since then, her popularity throughout the South East Asia music industry has remained strong, proven as she was voted as Most Popular Female Artiste ten times in a row and Regional Most Popular Artiste in 2011 in Anugerah Planet Muzik 2011, beating contenders from Malaysia, Singapore and Indonesia. Her eastern image was also being cited as a good example for other artists to follow. In 2008, former State Minister for Youth and Sport Affairs of Indonesia, [[Adhyaksa Dault]] has advised [[Dewi Persik]] who is known for her open and sexy dancing movements to tone down her performances and follow the steps that Siti Nurhaliza has taken when venturing into the entertainment industry{{cite web|title=Menpora Bantah 'Back Up' Dewi Persik|url=http://www.kapanlagi.com/showbiz/selebriti/menpora-bantah-back-up-dewi-persik-c7ecbyc.html|language=id|date=14 April 2008|work=KapanLagi.com|accessdate = 13 May 2012}}{{cite web|title=Menpora: Dewi Persik Bisa Laku Tanpa Goyang & Buka-bukaan|url=http://jakarta.okezone.com/read/2008/04/14/33/100345/menpora-dewi-persik-bisa-laku-tanpa-goyang-buka-bukaan|archive-url=https://archive.is/20130630015137/http://jakarta.okezone.com/read/2008/04/14/33/100345/menpora-dewi-persik-bisa-laku-tanpa-goyang-buka-bukaan|dead-url=yes|archive-date=30 June 2013|language=id|date=14 April 2008|work=OkeZone.com|accessdate=13 May 2012}} - "She's not over the top, she doesn't wear revealing clothes and doesn't dance sexily, but she's still able to be locally and internationally recognized".{{cite web|title=Dewi Persik Diminta Menpora Contek Siti Nurhaliza|url=http://hot.detik.com/read/2008/04/14/113918/922967/230/dewi-persik-diminta-menpora-contek-siti-nurhaliza|language=id|author=Anindhita Maharrani|date=14 April 2008|work=Hot.Detik.com|accessdate = 13 May 2012}} She has been cited as an idol and as an inspiration by many Malaysian and non-Malaysian artists like Malaysia's [[Aizat Amdan]],{{cite web|title=Aizat Tolak Hasrat Siti Nurhaliza, Sheila Majid|url=http://www.mstar.com.my/hiburan/berita-hiburan/2014/05/02/aizattolak-hasrat-artis-senior/|language=ms|author=Kemalia Othman|date=2 May 2014|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|mStar]]|accessdate=16 September 2010}}{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} [[Misha Omar]],{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza Inc.|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/11947010?pos=168&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1281969466%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=10 November 2003|work=myMetro|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Text Archive|accessdate = 17 August 2010}} [[Nicholas Teo]],{{cite web|title=Anugerah MTV untuk siapa?|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/46601019?pos=2&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1281969466%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=4 August 2008|work=Harian Metro|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Text Archive|accessdate = 17 August 2010}} [[Soo Wincci]],{{cite web|title=Album Melayu sentuhan Ajai|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/79187841?pos=4&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1342716635%3Aresultset|language=ms|author=Norhayati Nordin|date=23 January 2012|work=Harian Metro|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Text Archive|accessdate = 20 July 2012}} Singaporean Idol finalist, [[Maia Lee]], Indonesian pop group vocalist, Sunu, from Matta,{{cite web|title=Matta curi tumpuan peminat di Malaysia|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/28043682?pos=13&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1281969466%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=2 May 2008|work= Berita Harian|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Text Archive|accessdate = 16 August 2010}} Judika{{cite web|title=Judika Kagumi Amy Search & Luah Hasrat Ingin Berduet|url=http://www.rotikaya.com/judika-kagumi-amy-search-luah-hasrat-ingin-berduet/|language=ms|author=RotiKaya Staff|date=28 April 2012|work= RotiKaya.com|accessdate = 13 May 2012}} and many others. In 2007, her image likeness was used as part of the promotion by Malaysian Ministry of Tourism,{{cite web|title=Cartoon Siti acts as online envoy|url=http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2007/11/2/nation/19354564&sec=nation|date=2 November 2007|work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|accessdate=14 May 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121018011348/http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=%2F2007%2F11%2F2%2Fnation%2F19354564&sec=nation|archivedate=18 October 2012|df=dmy-all}} ''Malaysia Windows Live Agent – Siti'' to attract more visitors from Japan. The cartoon is used in the Windows Live Messenger (formerly known as [[MSN Messenger]]) where it will provide information on attractive tourist destinations in Malaysia. In January 2011, Siti was proposed as the cultural ambassador for Malay community by the Association of Malaysian and Indonesian Journalists (ISWAMI), based on both countries' communities acceptance of Siti's personality. ISWAMI chief believed that Siti may help ease strained relations should there be a crisis between Malaysia and Indonesia.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza proposed as cultural ambassador |url=http://www.bernama.com/bernama/v5/newsindex.php?id=560199|date=28 January 2011|work=[[Bernama]]| accessdate = 7 February 2011}} ===Themes and musical style=== As a lyricist and record producer, most of her singles' lyrics revolve around the theme of love, although she has penned numbers of thematic single of [[spirituality]]{{cite web|title=Tahajjud Cinta|url=http://sitizone.com/sz/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=103&Itemid=94|work=SitiZone.com|accessdate = 19 August 2010}} and [[feminism|female empowerment]].{{cite web|title=Emosi dua diva|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/3043646?pos=32&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1282145239%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=28 December 2009|work=Berita Harian|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Text Archive|accessdate = 19 August 2010}}{{cite web|title=Ukhuwah dua diva tersohor|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2009&dt=1202&pub=utusan_malaysia&sec=Hiburan&pg=hi_03.htm&arc=hive|author=Shazryn Mohd Faizal|language=ms|date=12 December 2009|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 20 August 2010}} Several of her singles were written by her were targeted to a specific party – ''[[Biarlah Rahsia]]'' (Let It Be A Secret) was written with the allusion to the media who constantly investigate her private personal relationships{{cite web|title=Biarlah Rahsia kisah cinta Siti Nurhaliza|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2006&dt=0424&pub=utusan_malaysia&sec=hiburan&pg=hi_02.htm&arc=hive&arc=hive|author=Mohammad Arif Nizam Abdullah|language=ms|date=24 June 2006|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 19 August 2010}} and ''Cahaya Cinta'' (Light of Love) was written specially for her husband during her marriage in 2006.{{cite web|title=Kemuncak cinta Siti Nurhaliza – Datuk K|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2006&dt=0830&pub=Utusan_Malaysia&sec=Hiburan&pg=hi_02.htm|author=Wanda Idris and Aziz Ittar|language=ms|date=30 August 2006|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 19 August 2010}} Born and raised in a traditional musically inclined family,{{cite web|title=Juara Lagu Unearths Another New Star.|url=http://www.simplysiti.com/1997/01/01/juara-lagu-unearths-another-new-star/|work=Simply Siti Nurhaliza Zone|accessdate=13 May 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20071110035658/http://www.simplysiti.com/1997/01/01/juara-lagu-unearths-another-new-star/|archivedate=10 November 2007|df=dmy-all}} she has recorded five ethnic pop oriented albums – four solo studio albums{{cite web|title=Lentera Timur|url=http://sitizone.com/sz/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=68&Itemid=81|work=SitiZone.com|accessdate = 19 August 2010}} and one duet studio album with [[Noraniza Idris]].{{cite web|title=Noraniza Idris mahu popularkan Seri Balas|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=1999&dt=0221&pub=utusan_malaysia&sec=Hiburan&pg=et_01.htm&arc=hive|author=Saharuddin Mustafa|language=ms|date=21 February 1999|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 19 August 2010}} She has been taught on how to sing traditional songs by her own mother who herself is a folk singer. She has been promoting this genre of music on almost each and every major concert of her like when she did at her concert at the Royal Albert Hall, medleys of Malay folk songs and traditional music songs.{{cite web|title=KONSERT SITI BERJAYA|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/45705773?pos=67&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1282145239%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=4 April 2005|work=Harian Metro|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Text Archive|accessdate = 16 August 2010}} ===Vocal abilities and profile=== Musically classified as a [[Mezzo-soprano#Coloratura mezzo-soprano|coloratura mezzo-soprano]], she's one of Malaysia's best singers for winning 13 times the award for the "Best Vocal Performance in an Album/Single" from Anugerah Industri Muzik, Malaysia's equivalent of [[Grammy Awards]].{{cite web|title=Lagu Melayu ke lagu Indonesia?|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/47947250?pos=5&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1281969466%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=8 May 2010|work=Harian Metro|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Text Archive|accessdate = 16 August 2010}}{{cite web|title=Sheila, Siti gegarkan AIM 17|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/47360343?pos=8&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1281969466%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=16 April 2010|work=Berita Harian|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Text Archive|accessdate = 16 August 2010}} Adjie Esa Poetra, an Indonesian vocal instructor described her voice as "She is very careful and never fails in the tone production and she's able to produce the most artistic and beautiful tone as possible.... In any songs, she can sing it with ease but powerful other than possessing more than four-octave vocal range."{{cite web|title=Merebut Habitat Siti Nurhaliza|url=http://simplysiti.com/merebut-habitat-siti-nurhaliza/|author=Adjie Esa Poetra|language=id|date=27 March 2005|work=www.pikiran-rakyat.com|publisher=Simply Siti Nurahliza Zone| accessdate = 27 July 2010}} {{listen|filename=Siti_Nurhaliza_-_Kurniaan_Dalam_Samaran.ogg|title="Kurniaan Dalam Samaran" (1999)|description=One of her songs that is rarely performed live and also one of the songs that is said to be the most technical in ''[[Pancawarna]]'' album}} M.Nasir, music critic and music composer has praised Siti's voice as saying, "When we talk about her, she is the voice...Give her any songs, she can deliver it very well and it is not a problem to find a suitable song for her." He further praised Siti for her brave efforts to experiment her voice [[melisma]] with new musics or songs.{{cite web|title=M.Nasir Puji Suara Dato' Siti Nurhaliza|url=http://www.budiey.com/m-nasir-puji-suara-dato-siti-nurhaliza/|author=Budiey Isma|language=ms|date=17 November 2008|work=Sensasi Selebriti| accessdate = 12 June 2010}} One of her trickiest songs to perform is ''Kurniaan Dalam Samaran'',{{cite web|title=Pancawarna|url=http://sitizone.com/sz/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=40&Itemid=60|work=SitiZone|accessdate = 12 June 2010}} a Japanese [[enka]]-influenced{{cite web|title=Siti pukau jutaan peminat|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2002&dt=0331&pub=Utusan_Malaysia&sec=Hiburan&pg=hi_06.htm|date= 31 March 2002|language=ms|work=Utusan Online| accessdate = 12 June 2010}} song where it requires her play of transition of [[alto]] to [[soprano]] vocal tones and she rarely performed it live.{{cite web|title=Siti's tour de force|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/1151551?pos=16&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1279461154%3Aresultset|author=Faridul Anwar Farinordin|date= 26 June 2009|work=New Straits Time|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Text Archive|accessdate = 12 June 2010}} However, at her recent ''[[SATU Konsert Eksklusif Dato' Siti Nurhaliza|SATU concert]]'', she performed it live, where it received appraisals from critics and fans where one of the reviewers cited her live rendition as, "The Japanese-flavoured song required her to switch from her natural voice to falsetto in a hair-raising cadenza somewhere in the absurdly high range most women vocalists would cringe from. But she pulled it off effortlessly, sending shivers down my spine." [[Gareth Gates]] who has performed together with Siti during MTV Asia Awards 2004 when he was asked what does he think about Siti, he said, "She definitely has the looks and she certainly has the voice. If she continues to sing the way she does, she'll go really far."{{cite web|title=It is so for Gareth|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/18312880?pos=236&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1279026498%3Aresultset|author=Faridul Anwar Farinordin|date=20 February 2004|work=New Straits Time|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Text Archive|accessdate = 13 July 2010}} [[Lea Salonga]], [[Filipino people|Filipino]] singer and actress who has done various theatrical work, including [[Miss Saigon]] and several Disney's movies has also expressed her praise and respect towards Siti's vocal ability during her concert in Malaysia in 2010 where she sang one of songs made famous by Siti and 2 By 2, ''Tiga Malam'' during the closing ceremony of her concert.{{cite web|title=Memang 'Power'|url=http://www.bharian.com.my/bharian/articles/Memang__8216_power__8217_/Article/index_html|date= 25 May 2010|author=Serimah Mohd Sallehuddin|language=ms|work=Berita Harian Online| accessdate = 12 June 2010}} In 2011, another Filipino artist, [[Gary Valenciano]] during his visit in Malaysia has expressed her admiration of Siti's vocal ability. He commented, "Based on what I've been told by the local media, I believe the best Malay song and the best vocal I've ever heard has to be Siti Nurhaliza's. If it was possible for me to meet her, I would definitely want to do a duet with her. If [I] were given a chance, I definitely want to compose a song for her, that is if she wishes."{{cite web|title=Gary V Teringin Berduet, Cipta Lagu Untuk Datuk Siti|url=http://www.murai.com.my/article/default.asp?article_id=10510&c=1&s=1|date=22 September 2011|author=Razif Rosdi|language=ms|work=Murai.com.my|accessdate=6 April 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120523012730/http://www.murai.com.my/article/default.asp?article_id=10510&c=1&s=1|archivedate=23 May 2012|df=dmy-all}} [[Sami Yusuf]] who requested for her to be featured in his album, ''Salaam'' has commented, "Siti is not only has a good voice, but also has an interesting personality. She is a real woman that Malaysia and ASEAN should be proud of."{{cite web|title=Satu penghormatan besar|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/89446353?pos=5&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1342716635%3Aresultset|language=ms|author=Ridzuan Abdul Rahman|date=12 July 2012|work=Harian Metro|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Text Archive|accessdate = 20 July 2012}} In 2013, an American singer, [[Babyface (musician)|Kenny Babyface]] who did a duet with her during Sapurakencana Petroleum Malaysia Grand Prix Charity Gala 2013 has also repeatedly expressed his admiration towards Siti. He praised Siti for her "beautiful voice" and her great singing skills.{{cite web|title=Malam Penuh Bermakna|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/103274918?pos=5&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1365247572%3Aresultset|language=ms|author=Norhadiani Baharom|date=27 March 2013|work=[[Harian Metro]]|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Text Archive|accessdate = 6 April 2013}}{{cite web|title=Babyface puji suara gemersik Siti|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/103175379?pos=7&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1365247572%3Aresultset|language=ms|author=Hanisah Selamat|date=25 March 2013|work=[[Berita Harian]]|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Text Archive|accessdate = 6 April 2013}} ==Personal achievements== ===Awards and accolades=== {{Main|List of awards and nominations received by Siti Nurhaliza}} ===Collaborations=== Siti has collaborated with many renowned Asian artists such as Hans Anwar and Lo'Ryder (Brunei), [[Preap Sovath]] (Cambodia), AB Three, [[Agnes Monica]],{{cite web|title=Agnes Monica The Most Commendable Artist 2008|url=http://www.asianbite.com/default.asp?display=2372|date=4 January 2009|work=Asianbite – Hoooked on Asian entertainment gossip!|accessdate=27 July 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110726092954/http://www.asianbite.com/default.asp?display=2372|archivedate=26 July 2011|df=dmy-all}} [[Chrisye]],{{cite web|title=BERSYUKUR DI ATAS RAHMAT-NYA|url=http://www.simplysiti.com/bersyukur-di-atas-rahmat-nya/|date=26 March 2006|language=ms|author=Siti Nurhaliza|work=Kosmo|accessdate=27 July 2010}}{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} [[Dewa 19]],{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza Akan Bawakan 15 Lagu di Surabaya|url=http://musik.kapanlagi.com/berita/siti-nurhaliza-akan-bawakan-15-lagu-di-surabaya-oh4dmju_print.html|language=id|date=24 November 2004|work=KapanLagi.com – Kalau bukan sekarang, kapan
