2011|df=dmy-all}} [[Gita Gutawa]],{{cite web|title=APM 2007 didominasi artis Malaysia|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2007&dt=0611&pub=Utusan_Malaysia&sec=Hiburan&pg=hi_05.htm|date=11 June 2006|language=ms|author=Khadijah Ibrahim|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 27 July 2010}} Harvey Malaiholo, Krisdayanti, Marcell, [[Melly Goeslaw]],{{cite web|title=Gemilang kemuncak APM2005|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/45764142?pos=14&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1281025117%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=21 February 2005|work=Harian Metro|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Text Archive|accessdate = 6 August 2010}} [[Padi (band)|Padi]],{{cite web|title=Siti hibur Megawati|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/44571932?pos=3&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1281025117%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=6 March 2004|work=Harian Metro|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Text Archive|accessdate = 6 August 2010}} [[Peterpan (band)|Peterpan]], [[Rossa (singer)|Rossa]],{{cite web|title=Mimpi Rossa duet Siti menjadi nyata.|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/30337213?pos=96&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1279114186%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=21 September 2005|work=Berita Harian|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Text Archive|accessdate = 18 July 2010}} Sahrul Gunawan, [[Titi DJ]]{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza Grogi Duet dengan Titi DJ|url=http://music.okezone.com/read/2012/12/12/391/731304/siti-nurhaliza-grogi-duet-dengan-titi-dj|date=12 December 2012|language=ms|author=Banda Haruddin Tanjung|work=music.okezone.com|accessdate=17 December 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130131060720/http://music.okezone.com/read/2012/12/12/391/731304/siti-nurhaliza-grogi-duet-dengan-titi-dj|archivedate=31 January 2013|df=dmy-all}} and Yana Julio (Indonesia), [[Hiroshi Takano]], Chika Yuri, Hideki Kurosawa INSPi, Leonard Eto, [[The Boom]], [[You Hitoto]] (Japan), Alexandra(Laos), [[Lay Phyu]] and Iron Cross (Myanmar), [[Jolina Magdangal]] and [[Kuh Ledesma]]{{cite web|title=Konsert Diva...gabung tiga negara|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2001&dt=1105&pub=utusan_malaysia&sec=Hiburan&pg=hi_02.htm&arc=hive|date=5 November 2001|language=ms|author=Zulkiflee Bakar|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 7 October 2010}} (Philippines), [[Francissca Peter|Francesca Peter]], [[Sun Ho]],{{cite web|title=RI pop/rock band Cokelat wins MTV Asia Awards|url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2003/01/25/ri-poprock-band-cokelat-wins-mtv-asia-awards.html|date=26 January 2003|work=The Jakarta Post|accessdate=2 August 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090819065705/http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2003/01/25/ri-poprock-band-cokelat-wins-mtv-asia-awards.html|archivedate=19 August 2009|df=dmy-all}}{{cite web|title=Best and worst, tidbits from the 2003 MTV Asia Awards|url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2003/02/02/best-and-worst-tidbits-2003-mtv-asia-awards.html|date=2 February 2003|work=The Jakarta Post|accessdate=22 May 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100612175549/http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2003/02/02/best-and-worst-tidbits-2003-mtv-asia-awards.html|archivedate=12 June 2010|df=dmy-all}} [[Tanya Chua]], [[Taufik Batisah]] (Singapore), Lee Hom Wang (Taiwan), Briohny, [[Palmy]] (Thailand), [[Tieu Lam Truong|Lam Trường]] (Vietnam). In addition, Siti had also collaborated with Gareth Gates (UK), during [[MTV Asia Awards]] 2004.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza menang anugerah Artis Pilihan Malaysia MTV Asia|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2004&dt=0215&pub=Utusan_Malaysia&sec=Muka_Hadapan&pg=mh_04.htm|language=ms|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 2 August 2010}} One of Thailand most sought after singers, [[Tata Young]] has also expressed her interest in collaborating with Siti and has praised Siti as "Asia's Mariah Carey" for her outstanding performances.{{cite web|title=Tata Young Kagumi Siti|url=http://www.simplysiti.com/tata-young-kagumi-siti/|language=ms|author=Shakilawati Abd Rahman|work=HarianMetro|accessdate = 18 January 2010}} From 2011 and 2012, she has recorded songs with [[Sean Kingston]], [[Christian Alexanda]] from Australia and [[Sami Yusuf]] from Britain.{{cite web|title=Sami Yusuf, reluctant rock star|url=http://www.thesundaily.my/news/367215|author=S. Indra Sathiabalan|work=The Sun Daily|accessdate=5 May 2012|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120523190533/http://www.thesundaily.my/news/367215|archivedate=23 May 2012|df=dmy-all}} She also has performed with Donnie Radford of [[The Platters]] on 30 November 2012 for a charity event in support of Breast Cancer awareness.{{cite web|title=Makan Malam Amal Bersama Siti Nurhaliza Berjaya Kumpul RM150 Ribu|url=http://www.ohbulan.com/makan-malam-amal-bersama-siti-nurhaliza-berjaya-kumpul-rm150-ribu/|date=3 December 2012|language=ms|author=Rifaee|work=OhBulan.com|accessdate = 17 December 2012}} ===International covers=== Throughout her career, Siti Nurhaliza's songs have been covered by other artists, including her first Malay traditional single, ''Cindai'' which was re-recorded in Chinese version by Chien Bai Hui, a Chinese singer, with also re-recorded Bukan Cinta Biasa and Tirai Semalam in Chinese version. Also, her first hit song in Indonesia, ''Aku Cinta Padamu'' was known as I Wonder when it was covered by [[North (band)|North]], an Australian boy band in their second album, Straight Up.{{cite web |title=North rakamkan lagu Aku Cinta Padamu |url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2006&dt=0505&pub=Utusan_Malaysia&sec=Hiburan&pg=hi_04.htm|language=ms|author=Mohd Arif Nizam Abdullah|date=5 May 2006|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 30 April 2010}} This song also re-recorded in Chinese and Bahasa version by Lin, an Indonesian singer. Her song Cinta Tak Berganti from Prasasti Seni also re-recorded by the Dutch band After Touch.{{cite web |url=http://www.aftertouch.nl/html/multimedia.html |title=Allround band "AfterTouch" |deadurl=yes |accessdate=1 February 2013 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130222152548/http://www.aftertouch.nl/html/multimedia.html |archivedate=22 February 2013 |df=dmy-all }} ===In popular culture=== ;In Music * Datuk M. Daud Kilau's ''Anak Seni''{{cite web |title=M. Daud Kilau – Puji Siti Nurhaliza dalam lagu.|url=http://www.simplysiti.com/m-daud-kilau-puji-siti-nurhaliza-dalam-lagu/|language=ms|author=Rosli Manah|work=Utusan|accessdate=29 April 2010}} * [[KRU]]'s ''Empat Syarat''{{cite web|title=Tawaran macho KRU.|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/4355452?pos=5&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1279114186%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=13 February 2005|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Text Archive|accessdate = 14 July 2010}} ===International performances=== By far, she has been thrice to be invited to perform at the MTV Asia Awards, which are in 2003, where she sang her debut, ''Bukan Cinta Biasa'', in 2004 where she performed together with Gareth Gates and her 2005 solo performance with ''Seindah Biasa'', one of her singles from her tenth solo album, [[Prasasti Seni]].{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza Artis Pilihan Malaysia kali ke-5|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2005&dt=0204&pub=Utusan_Malaysia&sec=Dalam_Negeri&pg=dn_10.htm|language=ms|date=3 February 2005|work=Utusan Online| accessdate = 2 August 2010}} However, one of her earliest performances at an international stage is during the closing ceremony of 1998 Commonwealth Games where it was watched by more than 70 countries when she was only 19. 1999 was the year of her debut at the 'Shanghai Music Festival 1999' in China and the 'South Pacific International Song and Singing Competition 1999', where she garnered a 'Gold Award' and 'Best Female Vocal Performance' respectively. She also has performed in Australia, Brunei, China, Indonesia, Japan, Kazakhstan, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, and United Kingdom. In March 2000, her first concert ever outside the Malaysian market in Singapore at [[HarbourFront Centre (Singapore)|Harbour Pavilion]] managed to outsold [[Mariah Carey]]'s [[Rainbow World Tour]] which was scheduled five days earlier{{cite web|title=Siti martabatkan lagu tradisional|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2000&dt=0325&pub=utusan_malaysia&sec=Hiburan&pg=et_01.htm&arc=hive|language=ms|author=Tengku Khalida Tengku Bidin|date=25 March 2000|work=Utusan Online| accessdate = 16 January 2012}} even though the most expensive tickets price was much higher than Carey's.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza's Concert in Singapore Tipped For Sellout|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2000&dt=0305&pub=utusan_express&sec=Front_Page&pg=fp_10.htm&arc=hive|date=3 March 2000|work=Utusan Online| accessdate = 16 January 2012}} In May 2006, she was offered to perform together with Indian [[Bollywood]] star, [[Shah Rukh Khan]] in front of 300 [[Bollywood]] artists and guests along with 2.6 billion television viewers where she will be performing at 2nd [[Global Indian Film Awards]] 2006 in Kuala Lumpur.{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza to sing at Bollywood film awards|url=http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2006/5/10/nation/14195934&sec=nation|date=6 May 2010|work=theStar Online|accessdate=20 January 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090617200735/http://www.thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=%2F2006%2F5%2F10%2Fnation%2F14195934&sec=nation|archivedate=17 June 2009|df=dmy-all}} However, the offer later was cancelled by Siti due to her commitment with other projects after informing the organizers beforehand.{{cite web|title=Siti hampakan Shah Rukh Khan|url=http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=/2006/12/4/HIBURAN/m_Aduh/Siti_hampakan_Shah_Rukh_Khan&sec=mstar_hiburan|language=ms|author=Radin Sri Ghazali|date=4 December 2006|work=mStar Online|accessdate=29 April 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101127182738/http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=%2F2006%2F12%2F4%2FHIBURAN%2Fm_Aduh%2FSiti_hampakan_Shah_Rukh_Khan&sec=mstar_hiburan|archive-date=27 November 2010|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} ===Wealth=== Siti is known to be a formidable and successful and well-known businesswoman in Malaysia. She currently tops the list of the 'Richest Artistes' in Malaysia. She is also reported to worth more than RM50 million as of 2010, enabling her to be named as one of the millionaires in entertainment industry, especially in the South East Asia region. As one of the most prolific artists in Malaysia, she is said to be paid RM 45,000 (USD$15 000) for a 30 minutes show and RM 70,000 (USD$23 333) for an hour show in 2009.{{cite web|title=The star will sing for you|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/1470830?pos=7&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1281025117%3Aresultset|author=Shuinb Taib|date=20 September 2009|work=New Straits Time|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search|accessdate = 3 January 2010}} ==Other ventures== ===Products and endorsements=== With success in her singing career, Siti then got herself involved in business. She set up her own company – Siti Nurhaliza Productions (M) Sdn. Bhd. – with activities generally in the entertainment scene. She has four subsidiary companies, [[Siti Nurhaliza Collections|Siti Nurhaliza Collections Sdn. Bhd.]], Siti Nurhaliza Marketing Sdn. Bhd., Siti Sound Sdn. Bhd. and SN Mobile Digital Sdn. Bhd. She is also the president of her own cosmetic range company, Simply Siti Sdn. Bhd.{{cite web|title=Lima Warna Baru Lipstik SimplySiti Dilancar|url=http://mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=/2010/10/1/mstar_hiburan/20100930201201&sec=mstar_hiburan|language=ms|date=1 October 2010|work=mStar Online|accessdate=19 October 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101002105421/http://www.mstar.com.my/hiburan/cerita.asp?file=%2F2010%2F10%2F1%2Fmstar_hiburan%2F20100930201201&sec=mstar_hiburan|archive-date=2 October 2010|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} Siti sells her own tea, Ctea,{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza introduces Ctea|url=http://old.brudirect.com/public_html/DailyInfo/News/Archive/Aug05/070805/nite22.htm|author=Sang Dewi & Rosh Abidin Yahya|work=BruDirect.com|accessdate=28 December 2009|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100406192825/http://old.brudirect.com/public_html/DailyInfo/News/Archive/Aug05/070805/nite22.htm|archivedate=6 April 2010|df=dmy-all}} brand of Malaysian tea, from tea cultivated on the foothills of [[Mount Kinabalu]], Sabah. This Ctea brand comes in two flavours, Geranium Special and [[Screwpine|Pandan]]. And now besides having her own products, she receives substantial income through commissions and royalties for her endorsements and as ambassador of products. She has been an ambassador and spokesperson for various international products{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza Tarudin Official|url=http://www.facebook.com/pages/Siti-Nurhaliza-Tarudin-Official/126837781389#/pages/Siti-Nurhaliza-Tarudin-Official/126837781389?v=info|work=Facebook|accessdate = 28 December 2009}} – [[Jusco]], [[Maxis Communications|Maxis]], [[Maybelline]], [[Minolta]], [[Mitsubishi]], [[Olay]], [[Pantene]], [[Pepsi]], [[Samsung]] and [[TM Net]]. {{clear}} ==Philanthropy== [[File:Siti Nurhaliza Khai.jpg|250px|thumb|right|Siti Nurhaliza during the Malay Mail Big Walk 2007, a charity event to collect some donations for children with bone cancer.{{cite web|title=THE MALAY MAIL BIG WALK 2007|url=http://www.pacesetters.com.my/resource/news/mmbw.htm|date=22 April 2007|work=Pacesetters – Athletic Club Malaysia|accessdate=17 July 2010|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110722231456/http://www.pacesetters.com.my/resource/news/mmbw.htm|archivedate=22 July 2011|df=dmy-all}}]] Throughout her career, she has been involved in a number of charity-related event, including organising charity concerts,{{Cite news|title=Siti to host two charity concerts in T'ganu.|url=http://www.accessmylibrary.com/article-1G1-127965461/siti-host-two-charity.html|date=30 January 2005|work=Bernama|publisher=[[AccessMyLibrary]]|accessdate = 13 May 2013}} open houses{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza, Datuk K teruskan tradisi hulur zakat bantu penduduk|url=http://www.utusan.net.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2011&dt=0808&pub=utusan_malaysia&sec=Dalam_Negeri&pg=dn_11.htm|language=ms|date=29 February 2008|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 13 May 2013}} and launching her own charity funds.{{Cite news|title=Siti's broken promise.|url=http://www.accessmylibrary.com/coms2/summary_0286-20793948_ITM|date=24 March 2004|work=New Straits Time|publisher=[[AccessMyLibrary]]|accessdate = 13 May 2013}}{{cite web|title=DCHL lancar program kumpul dana bersama Yayasan Nurjiwa|url=http://www.simplysiti.com/dchl-lancar-program-kumpul-dana-bersama-yayasan-nurjiwa/|author=Nur Farhatul Aishati Azharie|language=ms|date=29 February 2008|publisher=Berita Harian|work=Simplysiti.com|accessdate = 11 June 2010}} In March 2004, she launched ''Tabung Prihatin Siti'', making her the first Malaysian artist to have a charity fund after her namesake whose aim to raise at least RM 50 000 for children's education and medical treatment. In January 2005, Nurhaliza donated [[Malaysian ringgit|RM]] 35 000 (about United States dollar11,000) to three different organisations for the [[2004 Indian Ocean earthquake|2004 tsunami]] victims before her concert at the Royal Albert Hall in April of the same year.{{Cite news|title=Songbird Siti chips in RM25 000|url=http://www.accessmylibrary.com/coms2/summary_0286-18509096_ITM|date=7 January 2005|work=New Straits Time|publisher=[[AccessMyLibrary]]|accessdate = 11 June 2010}} A year later in February, she donated RM 500 000 for the National Anti-Drug Campaign where she was also appointed as the ambassadress for the campaign.{{Cite news|title=Siti Nurhaliza Donates RM500 000 For National Anti Drug Campaign|url=http://www.accessmylibrary.com/article-1G1-142667539/siti-nurhaliza-donates-rm500000.html|date=19 February 2006|work=Bernama|publisher=[[AccessMyLibrary]]|accessdate = 11 June 2010}} Six months later, she and her husband founded Yayasan Nurjiwa (Nurjiwa Foundation) where the foundation served as a platform for people to help those in need through charity concerts and dinner events where the money will be donated to the selected organisations. In 2009, she and her husband donated RM 1.5 million to build a new mosque in Tikam Batu, [[Kuala Muda]] where the land was given as a ''[[Waqf|wakaf]]'' by both of them and Siti's mother-in-law where before this, her husband has also donated a sum of money to build two mosques in Kuala Lumpur and [[Pattani]], Thailand{{cite web|title=Siti Nurhaliza, suami sumbang RM1.5 juta bina masjid|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2009&dt=0521&pub=Utusan_Malaysia&sec=Dalam_Negeri&pg=dn_33.htm|language=ms|date=20 May 2009|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 11 June 2010}} which finally completed in February 2011 and officiated by Sultan of [[Kedah]], [[Abdul Halim of Kedah|Tuanku Abdul Halim Muadzam Shah]].{{cite web|title=Masjid dibiayai Siti dan Datuk K di Sungai Petani siap |url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2009&dt=0521&pub=Utusan_Malaysia&sec=Dalam_Negeri&pg=dn_33.htm|language=ms|date=20 February 2011|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 25 February 2011}} In 2011, Siti and her husband gave out an undisclosed amount of ''[[Zakat]]'' (alms) to more than 200 elderly people, single mothers and disabled people in Tikam Batu as part of their tradition apart from providing them with [[sarong]], [[batik]] and some "Duit Raya" (pocket money during [[Eid al-Fitr]]) for the children. ==Personal life== ===Relationship with Khalid Mohamad Jiwa=== [[File:Siti Nurhaliza & Dato' Khalid.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Siti Nurhaliza and her husband, Datuk Khalid during the [[Malay Mail]] Big Walk in 2007.]] On 17 July 2006, after months of speculation by the media, Siti and her then-fiancé, Datuk Khalid made a press conference announcing that their wedding would be held on 21 August.{{cite web|title=Keluarga suka Siti|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/45917008?pos=5&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1284712231%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=18 July 2006|work=Harian Metro|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search|accessdate = 17 September 2010}} Her plan to marry Datuk Khalid caused criticisms and uproar, since she was going to marry a 47-year-old divorcee with four sons{{cite web|title=Cerita sensasi panaskan dunia hiburan negara|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/29965842?pos=2&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1284712231%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=30 December 2006|work=Berita Harian|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search|accessdate = 17 September 2010}} where she was accused of causing his divorce. However, the issue was rebutted when Jabatan Agama Islam Selangor (Selangor Islamic Council) verified that Datuk Khalid and his former wife, Tengku Zawyah Tengku Izham officially separated in February 2004, after 15 years of marriage.{{cite web|title=Datuk K tak perlu kebenaran berpoligami|url=http://www.nib.com.my/archives/text/view/29777879?pos=3&hide_header=1&resultset=nstpec%3Awww/cross-search/search.php%3A_1284712231%3Aresultset|language=ms|date=7 July 2006|work=Berita Harian|publisher=Digital Collections DC5: Cross Search|accessdate = 17 September 2010}} Some sources speculated that the total wedding cost was RM 12,888,888 (USD 3,947,980 (adjusted to 2010 inflation)),{{Cite news|title=DATUK K DENIES NEWS REPORT OF EXTRAVAGANT WEDDING|url=http://www.accessmylibrary.com/article-1G1-151795598/datuk-k-denies-news.html|date=12 August 2006|work=Bernama|publisher=[[AccessMyLibrary]]| accessdate = 8 May 2010}} however it was later denied by the couple and the wedding planner and stated that the total cost was roughly around RM 500,000.{{Cite news|title=Princess of Pop's regal wedding|url=http://www.accessmylibrary.com/article-1G1-148349919/princess-pop-regal-wedding.html|author=Hafidah Samat|date=18 July 2006|work=Bernama|publisher=[[AccessMyLibrary]]| accessdate = 8 May 2010}} Her wedding dowry was revealed to cost at RM 22,222 and the ''hantaran'' (gifts from groom to bride and vice versa) cost around RM 30,000. The total sponsored items including Siti and spouse's jewelleries, dresses, etc., cost more than RM 9 million.{{Cite news|title=In ringgit and sen|url=http://www.accessmylibrary.com/article-1G1-150564451/ringgit-and-sen.html|date=29 August 2006|work=New Straits Time|publisher=[[AccessMyLibrary]]| accessdate = 8 May 2010}} Later, RM 1 million from the total price paid by TV3 to broadcast the whole ceremony was later donated to charity.{{Cite news|title=Fairy-tale wedding, no less|url=http://www.accessmylibrary.com/article-1G1-150886113/fairy-tale-wedding-no.html|date=2 September 2006|work=New Straits Time|publisher=[[AccessMyLibrary]]| accessdate = 8 May 2010 | first=Suraya | last=Al-Attas}} The engagement ceremony was held at Masjid Wilayah Persekutuan ([[Federal Territory Mosque]]) on 21 August 2006. The ceremony was also televised live and gathered more than 2 millions viewers. The first wedding reception was held on 28 August 2006, at the [[Kuala Lumpur Convention Centre]] (KLCC). and was televised to 6.3 millions viewers nationwide.{{cite web | title=The Ratings are in: Siti 6.3 million Log | url=http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2006/8/30/nation/15279128&sec=nation 14 | date=30 August 2006 | work=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]] | accessdate=30 August 2006 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071014034436/http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=%2F2006%2F8%2F30%2Fnation%2F15279128&sec=nation | archivedate=14 October 2007 | df=dmy-all }} The wedding also received coverage from Indonesia, where 10 Indonesian media representatives were there to capture the moment including [[Trans TV]], [[SCTV (Indonesia)|SCTV]] and [[Jawa Pos]].{{cite web|title=Persandingan Siti – Datuk K meriah|url=http://www.utusan.com.my/utusan/info.asp?y=2006&dt=0829&pub=Utusan_Malaysia&sec=Dalam_Negeri&pg=dn_01.htm|language=ms|date=29 August 2006|work=Utusan Online|accessdate = 3 May 2010}}{{cite web | title=Wedding Reception of Siti-Datuk K Steeped in Tradition | url=http://www.simplysiti.com/category/bernama/page/4/ | date=29 August 2006 | work=Bernama | accessdate=30 August 2006 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://archive.is/20100406173112/http://www.simplysiti.com/category/bernama/page/4/ | archivedate=6 April 2010 | df=dmy-all }} Photographed by celebrity photographer [[Kid Chan]],{{cite news|last=Khoo|first=Rubin|title=The kid grows up|url=http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2008/1/20/yummy/20080119111950&sec=yummy|archive-url=https://archive.is/20130111204356/http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2008/1/20/yummy/20080119111950&sec=yummy|dead-url=yes|archive-date=11 January 2013|accessdate=3 January 2012|newspaper=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]]|date=20 January 2008}} it was a star-studded affair, with guests including royal families, VIPs, celebrities, close friends and family. Indonesian celebrities like [[Hetty Koes Endang]] and one of Siti's closest friends, Krisdayanti were given the opportunity to give a performance to the newlywed and guests. A second reception was held on 3 September 2006, in Siti's hometown of Kuala Lipis, Pahang where more than 10,000 people attended the ceremony including those from neighbouring countries.{{Cite news|title=10,000 attend Siti's reception|url=http://www.accessmylibrary.com/article-1G1-150887443/10000-attend-siti-reception.html|author=M. Hamzah Jamaludin|date=4 September 2006|work=New Straits Time|publisher=[[AccessMyLibrary]]| accessdate = 8 May 2010}} In the same year, the wedding charted as one of the 20 top celebrity weddings on [[Yahoo! Buzz]].{{cite web|title=Cinta Siti, Datuk K makin utuh|trans-title=Siti and Datuk K's Love is Growing Stronger|url=http://www.sinarharian.com.my/hiburan/cinta-siti-datuk-k-makin-utuh-1.422052|author=Sinar Harian Staff|date=21 August 2015|work=[[Sinar Harian]]}} In 2011, her wedding was also listed in [[CNBC]]'s "Asia's Most High-Profile Weddings", where her wedding was ranked in the top 5.{{cite web|title=Asia's Most High-Profile Weddings|url=https://www.cnbc.com/id/42639189/page/1|author=Rajeshni Naidu-Ghelani|date=26 April 2011|work=[[CNBC]]| accessdate = 26 January 2014}}{{cite web|title=Asia's Most High-Profile Weddings|url=https://www.cnbc.com/id/42639189/page/6|author=Rajeshni Naidu-Ghelani|date=26 April 2011|work=[[CNBC]]| accessdate = 26 January 2014}} On 13 June 2010, Siti and her husband, Datuk Seri Khalid, was recognised by [[E! News|E! News Asia]] as the Third Most Powerful Celebrity Couple in Asia, behind Chinese entertainer couple, [[Simon Yam]] and wife, [[Qi Qi (model)|Qi Qi]] and Bollywood superstar couple, [[Aishwarya Rai]] and husband, [[Abhishek Bachchan]].{{cite web|title=Video: E! News Report: Asia’s Most Powerful Couple In Asia|url=http://www.aishwarya-spice.com/video-e-news-asias-most-powerful-couples/|date=13 June 2010|work=Aishwarya-Spice.com|accessdate=3 September 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101029163520/http://www.aishwarya-spice.com/video-e-news-asias-most-powerful-couples|archive-date=29 October 2010|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}{{cite web|title=E! News report: #1 Powerful Couple in Asia-Aishwarya and Abhishek|url=http://www.pinkvilla.com/entertainmenttags/abhishek-bachchan/e-news-report-1-powerful-couple-asiaaishwarya-and-abhishek|date=13 June 2010|work=PinkVilla.com|accessdate = 3 September 2010}} In December, 2015, Siti suffered a miscarriage two months into her pregnancy prompting her to share her difficult fertility journey with the public. In October, 2017 after seeking longterm treatment at a fertility centre, Siti announced via social media live that she was expecting her first child with Datuk Khalid. Their daughter was born on 19 March 2018 via caesarean section. The new parents said they chose Monday as the delivery date for their first child as it coincided with the Prophet [[Muhammad]]’s birthday.{{cite news|url=http://www.mstar.com.my/hiburan/berita-hiburan/2017/10/13/siti-nurhaliza-hamil/|title=Siti Nurhaliza Buka Rahsia Hamil 4 Bulan|accessdate=14 October 2017|work=Mohd Al-Qayum Azizi|publisher=''[[mSTAR Online]]''|date=13 October 2017}}{{cite news|url=http://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/lifestyle/malaysian-singer-siti-nurhaliza-pregnant-with-her-first-child-9309592|title=Malaysian singer Siti Nurhaliza pregnant with her first child|accessdate=14 October 2017|work=|publisher=[[Channel NewsAsia]]|date=13 October 2017}}{{cite news|url=http://www.ibtimes.sg/malaysian-singer-siti-nurhaliza-confirms-her-pregnancy-18040|title=Malaysian singer Siti Nurhaliza confirms her pregnancy|accessdate=14 October 2017|work=Nirmal Narayanan|publisher=International Business Times|date=13 October 2017}}{{cite news|url=http://www.astroawani.com/berita-hiburan/sah-siti-nurhaliza-hamil-157905|title=Sah! A '''strategic bankruptcy''' may occur when an otherwise solvent company makes use of the [[bankruptcy|bankruptcy laws]] for some specific business purpose.<ref>See Kevin J. Delaney, Strategic Bankruptcy (University of California Press, 1998) for a discussion of this phenomenon by reference to particular cases.</ref> For example, in 2002 [[Kmart]] filed [[Chapter 11]] for protection from creditors. One of the main problems affecting Kmart's cash flow and therefore its liquidity was that Kmart was locked into long-term leases at premium rates with respect to various unprofitable stores. While in chapter 11 reorganization, Kmart was able to renegotiate or rescind those particular leases.
In some countries, like Sweden, it is common at least for smaller companies with deep debts, to have a bankruptcy, and close down the company, but where the owner has prepared a new company which buys important assets including the name, and continues with much smaller debts.

[[Henry Lee III]] (father)
[[Anne Hill Carter Lee|Anne Hill Carter]] (mother) | laterwork = }} '''Sydney Smith Lee''' (September 2, 1802 – July 22, 1869), called '''Smith Lee''' in his lifetime, was an American naval officer who served as a captain in the [[Confederate States Navy]] during the [[American Civil War]]. He was the third child of [[Henry Lee III|Henry "Light Horse Harry" Lee]] and [[Anne Hill Carter Lee]], and the older brother of Confederate general [[Robert E. Lee]]. ==Early life and education== Lee was born in Camden, New Jerseyhttp://leefamilyarchive.org/reference/books/alexander/index.html on September 2, 1802. At the age of 18 on December 30, 1820 he was appointed [[midshipman]] in the [[United States Navy]] and 8 years later promoted to lieutenant on May 17, 1828. During the [[Mexican–American War]] Lee fought in the [[Battle of Veracruz]] with his brother [[Robert E. Lee|Robert E.]]; and afterwards was stationed there. He was promoted to [[commander]] on June 4. 1850 and accompanied [[Commodore (United States)|Commodore]] [[Matthew C. Perry|Perry]] to Japan in 1853, commanding his flagship [[USS Mississippi (1841)|''USS Mississippi'']]. ==Career== Commander Lee served as commandant of the [[United States Naval Academy|U.S. Naval Academy]] and [[Philadelphia Navy Yard]]. He resigned from the service on April 17, 1861, the day [[Virginia in the American Civil War#Secession timeline|Virginia declared it had seceded]] though the resignation was not accepted. After dismissal on April 22, 1861 he accepted a commission as commander in the [[Confederate States Navy]]. When the U.S. Navy abandoned the [[Gosport Navy Yard]] in [[Norfolk, Virginia]], Commander Lee became the commanding officer there. When Union forces regained it, he was put in charge of batteries at [[Drewry's Bluffs, Virginia]]. On May 6, 1864, he became chief of the Confederate Navy's Bureau of Orders and Detail, replacing [[Captain (naval)|Captain]] [[John K. Mitchell]]. Lee was promoted to captain, and remained at this post until the end of the war. Lee fought for the Confederacy reluctantly. As late as 1863 he denounced South Carolina for "getting us into this snarl" of secession, complaining that Robert and his family had persuaded him to act against his love of the US Navy.{{cite web|url=http://www.americanheritage.com/content/robert-e-lee%E2%80%99s-%E2%80%9Cseverest-struggle%E2%80%9D|first=Elizabeth Brown|last=Pryor|title=Robert E. Lee's 'Severest Struggle'|publisher=American Heritage|year=2008}} ==Family and death== Lee's wife was Anne Marie Mason of Virginia. One of their sons was Confederate [[Major General]] [[Fitzhugh Lee]] who later became [[Governor of Virginia]], diplomat and writer; and served as Major General of [[United States Volunteers|U.S. Volunteers]] during the [[Spanish–American War]]. At least four more of his sons served in the Confederate States Army or Navy. After the war Lee became a farmer and died at [[Richlands, Virginia]], on July 22, 1869. ==References== {{DEFAULTSORT:Lee, Sydney Smith}} [[Category:1802 births]] [[Category:1869 deaths]] [[Category:American military personnel of the Mexican–American War]] [[Category:American people of English descent]] [[Category:Burials at Old Christ Church Episcopal Cemetery (Alexandria, Virginia)]] [[Category:Confederate States Navy captains]] [[Category:Lee family of Virginia]] [[Category:Mason family]] [[Category:Northern-born Confederates]] [[Category:People from Westmoreland County, Virginia]] [[Category:People of Virginia in the American Civil War]] [[Category:United States Navy officers]]

{{Infobox pageant titleholder | name=Varinthorn Phadoongvithee | title=[[Miss Thailand Universe|Miss Thailand Universe 2001]] | nationalcompetition=[[Miss Thailand Universe|Miss Thailand Universe 2001]] (winner), [[Miss Thailand|Miss Thailand 1998]], [[Miss Universe 2001]] | birth_place= [[Nonthaburi Province|Nonthaburi]], [[Thailand]] | birth_name= Varinthorn Phadoongvithee | birth_date= {{Birth date and age|mf=yes|1976|10|28}} | nickname= Auan | height={{height|ft=5|in=8}} | eye_color= Black | hair_color= Black | measurements = 32-25-36 | ethnicity= [[Asian people|Asian]] }} '''Varinthorn Phadoongvithee''' ({{lang-th|วรินทร ผดุงวิถี}}) is a businesswoman and the 2001 [[Miss Thailand Universe]].
==Biography== Varinthorn Phadoongvithee was born and raised in Nonthaburi.
==Pageantry== Phadoongvithee was crowned second Miss Thailand Universe on March 24, 2001.
After becoming Miss Thailand Universe, she travelled to [[Bayamón]], [[Puerto Rico]] to compete in the [[Miss Universe 2001]] pageant, held at the [[Coliseo Rubén Rodríguez]] on May 11, 2001 but did not place. Miss Puerto Rico, [[Denise Quiñones]] was crowned Miss Universe 2001.
==External links== *[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6rwgBFdHayw Crowning Moment] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20071019112334/http://www.mardoo.net/ Sawasdee Pageant The Majestic World of Beauty Pageant]
{{S-start}} {{Succession box | before=[[Kulthida Yenprasert]] | title=[[Miss Thailand Universe]] | years=2001 | after=[[Janjira Janchome]] }} {{S-end}} {{Miss Universe 2001 delegates}} {{Authority control}}

{{refimprove|date=March 2014}} {{Use mdy dates|date=February 2012}} {{Infobox Lt Governor |name=Winthrop Paul Rockefeller |image=Paige, Huckabee, Rockefeller, and Hutchinson with large check, August 2002 - cropped to Rockefeller.jpg |imagesize=205px |order=17th [[Lieutenant Governor of Arkansas]] |term=November 1996 – July 16, 2006 |governor= Mike Huckabee |predecessor=[[Mike Huckabee]] |successor=[[Bill Halter]] |birth_date=September 17, 1948 |birth_place=[[New York City]], [[New York (state)|New York]], U.S. |death_date={{death date and age|2006|7|16|1948|9|17}} |death_place=[[Little Rock, Arkansas]] |party=[[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] |children= 7 |parents = [[Winthrop Rockefeller]]
Jievute "Bobo" Paulekiute |relatives = See [[Rockefeller family]] |profession=Politician, farmer, businessman |spouse=Deborah Cluett Sage
(m. 1971–1979; divorced)
Lisenne Dudderar
(m. 1983–2006; his death) |alma_mater=[[Texas Christian University]] |footnotes= }} '''Winthrop Paul "Win" Rockefeller''' (September 17, 1948 – July 16, 2006) was an American [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] politician and businessman who served as the 17th [[Lieutenant Governor]] of [[Arkansas]] from 1996 until his death in 2006. He was a member of the [[Rockefeller family]]. ==Early life == Rockefeller was born in [[New York City]], [[New York (state)|New York]], the only child of [[governor of Arkansas|Arkansas Governor]] [[Winthrop Rockefeller]] (1912—1973) and actress Jievute "Bobo" Paulekiute (1916—2008). His parents separated in 1950 and divorced four years later. His maternal grandparents were [[Lithuania|Lithuanian]].http://www.nysun.com/obituaries/bobo-rockefeller-91-married-well-divorced-better/76767/ Rockefeller grew up in both the United States and in [[Europe]] and was educated at schools in New York, [[England]], and in [[Switzerland]]. He graduated from [[Texas Christian University]] in [[Fort Worth]], [[Texas]], a degree in Ranch Management. ==Career== Rockefeller served from 1981 to 1995 on the Arkansas State Police Commission. In 1991, he was appointed by President [[George H. W. Bush]] to serve on the President’s Council on Rural America and became chairman of the council. He was a president of the [[Quapaw Area Council]] of the [[Boy Scouts of America]] and served on the board of directors of the national Scouting organization. He was elected his state's [[lieutenant governor]] in a November 1996 [[special election]] triggered by the resignation of Governor [[Jim Guy Tucker]] and the succession to the governorship of then-Lieutenant Governor [[Mike Huckabee]]. Rockefeller was subsequently re-elected in 1998 to a full four-year term with 67 percent of the vote, far greater than the vote received by his father in the 1966 and 1968 gubernatorial elections. Rockefeller was elected once again in 2002 with 60 percent of the vote. According to his website: "As Lieutenant Governor he focused on economic development, education and literacy. As Acting Governor on September 11, 2001, the day terrorists attacked the [[World Trade Center (1973–2001)|World Trade Center]] and [[The Pentagon]], he resisted calls to declare a state of emergency and instead urged Arkansans to remain calm and to donate blood. He sponsored Project ChildSafe, a national firearms safety program that has distributed hundreds of thousands of free [[Gun safety#Locks|trigger locks]] in Arkansas. He was honorary chairman of the Arkansas Literary Festival. In 1997, Rockefeller created ''Books in the Attic'', a program using existing resources, Boy Scouts, and volunteers to ensure access to reading opportunities for all children. In 2004, he served as the chairman of the [[Arkansas Republican Party]].[http://www.state.ar.us/ltgov/ Arkansas Lieutenant Governor Bill Halter] ==Personal life== On March 22, 1971, Rockefeller married Deborah Cluett Sage of New York, the eldest daughter of Louis Davidson Sage and the former Constance Cluett Ward. The couple met while both were studying in [[Oxford, England]]. The wedding took place at the Bruton Parish Church at [[Colonial Williamsburg]] in [[Virginia (U.S. state)|Virginia]]. The couple had three children: *Andrea Davidson Rockefeller (b. July 31, 1972) *Katherine Cluett Rockefeller (b. February 7, 1974) *Winthrop Paul Rockefeller Jr. (b. July 10, 1976) The couple divorced on January 11, 1979. On June 4, 1983, Rockefeller married Lisenne Dudderar, an administrative assistant with the Arkansas [[Nature Conservancy]]. They had four sons: *William Gordon Rockefeller *Colin Kendrick Rockefeller (born c. 1990) *John Alexander Camp Rockefeller *Louis Henry Rockefeller{{cite web|title=Freeman & Wright|url=http://www.thefreelibrary.com/Freeman+%26+Wright-a0194193029|publisher=The Free Library|year=2009}}{{cite news|last=Kowal|first=Jessica|title=A Seattle School Where Extra Kindness Is Part of the Curriculum|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2006/05/26/education/26hutch.html?pagewanted=print&_r=0|accessdate=April 13, 2014|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|date=May 26, 2006}} They adopted a daughter, Grace, in [[Hong Kong]]. Win and Lisenne founded a school for children with learning disabilities in Little Rock, now known as the Academy at [[Riverdale (Little Rock)|Riverdale]]. ==Wealth== Rockefeller served as chief executive of Winrock Farms, Inc., which had been set up by his father, and had interests in various small businesses around the state: in retailing, automobiles, farming, and the resort industry. He was an active member of the [[National Federation of Independent Business]]. Rockefeller was ranked # 283 on the ''[[Forbes]]'' magazine list of the nation's wealthiest people in 2005, with a fortune the magazine estimated at $1.2 billion. As lieutenant governor, which was a part-time job, he forwarded his $34,673 state salary to charity.[http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/news/nation/2006-07-16-rockefeller_x.htm Ark. Lt. Gov. Win Paul Rockefeller dies - USA Today, 16 July 2006] ==Illness and death== Rockefeller had announced his candidacy for governor and was expected to face the more conservative [[Asa Hutchinson]] in the Republican primary election in May 2006. On July 20, 2005, however, he bowed out of the race, citing [[Myeloproliferative neoplasm|myeloproliferative disease]], a blood disorder that can develop into [[leukemia]] if left untreated. In October 2005 and March 2006, Rockefeller underwent unsuccessful [[Hematopoietic stem cell transplantation|bone marrow transplants]] at the [[Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center]] in [[Seattle]], [[Washington (U.S. state)|Washington]]. On July 8, 2006, after the failure of his second bone marrow transplant, he returned to Little Rock, where he died eight days later at the [[University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences]]. On July 19, his body lay in state in the rotunda of the [[Arkansas State Capitol]], and the next day, a memorial service was held at [[Pulaski Heights]] [[United Methodist Church]], of which Rockefeller was a member. At the time of his death, he was survived by his mother, wife, children, and one granddaughter. {{Portalbar|Biography|New York City|England|Arkansas|Politics|Business and Economics|Methodism}} ==See also== *[[Rockefeller family]] *[[Winthrop Rockefeller]] ==References== {{reflist|colwidth=30em}} ==External links== *[https://www.nytimes.com/2006/07/17/us/17rockefeller.html?ex=1310788800&en=d7ea97306cfad739&ei=5090&partner=rssuserland&emc=rss "Arkansas Lt. Gov. Winthrop Rockefeller Dies at 57"], [[New York Times]], July 17, 2006 *[http://www.kthv.com/news/news.aspx?storyid=31330 "Lt. Gov. Win Rockefeller Dies Peacefully"], Todaysthv.com July 17, 2006. {{s-start}} {{s-off|us}} {{succession box | title=[[Lieutenant Governor of Arkansas]] | before=[[Mike Huckabee]] | after=[[Bill Halter]] | years=November 1996 – July 16, 2006 }} {{s-end}} {{Lieutenant Governors of Arkansas}} {{Rockefeller family}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Rockefeller, Winthrop Paul}} [[Category:1948 births]] [[Category:2006 deaths]] [[Category:Politicians from New York City]] [[Category:People from Morrilton, Arkansas]] [[Category:Lieutenant Governors of Arkansas]] [[Category:Rockefeller family]] [[Category:Arkansas Republican state chairmen]] [[Category:Arkansas Republicans]] [[Category:American energy industry businesspeople]] [[Category:Farmers from Arkansas]] [[Category:Ranchers from Arkansas]] [[Category:Businesspeople from Arkansas]] [[Category:Alumni of Institut Le Rosey]] [[Category:Texas Christian University alumni]] [[Category:People associated with the Boy Scouts of America]] [[Category:Deaths from cancer in Arkansas]] [[Category:Deaths from leukemia]] [[Category:Dudley–Winthrop family]]

{{EngvarB|date=January 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2018}} {{Infobox person | name = Xavier Di Petta | birth_place = [[Shepparton]], Victoria, Australia | occupation = Partner of MedSpa Advertising | alma_mater = [[University of Southern California]] | residence = Los Angeles, California, United States }}
'''Xavier Di Petta''' is an Australian [[computer programmer]], [[Internet entrepreneur]], and a creator of EarthPix and HistoryInPics.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theatlantic.com/technology/archive/2014/01/the-2-teenagers-who-run-the-wildly-popular-twitter-feed-historyinpics/283291/|title=The 2 Teenagers Who Run the Wildly Popular Twitter Feed @HistoryInPics|author=Alexis C. Madrigal|date=23 January 2014|work=The Atlantic|accessdate=26 October 2015}}</ref> Di Petta has been featured in [[The Times]]' 'Top 25 Under 20' and 'The 15 Smartest Teens on the Planet'.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thetimes.co.uk/tto/life/article4172099.ece|title=Top 25 under 20|newspaper=[[The Times]] | location=UK|accessdate=26 October 2015}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.pressreader.com/australia/shepparton-news/20151208/281492160250456/TextView|title=PressReader.com – Connecting People Through News|website=''pressreader.com''|access-date=27 May 2016}}</ref> Di Petta has amassed followings that exceed 100 million across various social networks.<ref>https://www.charlottefast.com/xavier-di-petta/</ref> Di Petta is currently a Partner at [[MedSpa Advertising]] in Beverly Hills, CA, the fastest going ad agency in North America for medical aesthetic clinics.<ref name="LinkedIn"/> <ref>https://www.charlottefast.com/xavier-di-petta/</ref>
==Early life== Di Petta was born and raised in [[Shepparton, Victoria]], a small Australian town two hours north of [[Melbourne]]. At six, he represented Australia in the [[Nintendo World Championships]].<ref name="smh">{{cite web|url=http://www.smh.com.au/small-business/entrepreneur/just-an-everyday-50kamonth-teen-20121111-296aw.html | title=Just an everyday $50K-a-month teen|author=Max Mason|work=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] | location=Australia|accessdate=26 October 2015}}</ref> Di Petta attended the [[University of Southern California]], where he was a member of Society53.<ref name="LinkedIn">{{Cite web|url=https://www.linkedin.com/in/xavierdipetta|title=Xavier Di Petta {{!}} LinkedIn|website=www.linkedin.com|access-date=28 May 2016}}</ref>
==Career== In 2009, Di Petta "found email addresses for YouTube staffers in a lawsuit document and contacted them directly about a new program that allowed him to make money from his videos."<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/for-generation-z-email-has-become-a-rite-of-passage-1460347264|title=For Generation Z, Email Has Become a Rite of Passage|last=Mims|first=Christopher|date=11 April 2016|newspaper=The Wall Street Journal|issn=0099-9660|access-date=28 May 2016}}</ref>
In 2012, Di Petta created Fitspiration, designed to help users keep motivated about fitness.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=http://www.smh.com.au/small-business/entrepreneur/just-an-everyday-50kamonth-teen-20121111-296aw.html|title=Just an everyday $50K-a-month teen|website=The Sydney Morning Herald|access-date=27 May 2016}}</ref> The application was the number-one fitness application in the United States, Australia and [[New Zealand]], among others.<ref name=":0" /> Di Petta's firm, Swift Fox Labs, works with brands such as [[NBC]], [[GE]] and [[Nike, Inc.|Nike]].<ref name="smh" /> In July 2013, Di Petta created @EarthPix and @HistoryInPics on Twitter with Kyle Cameron.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/b193e52a-a0b0-11e4-9aee-00144feab7de.html|title=Haunted by historical images in digital form|last=Jacobs|first=Emma|date=22 January 2015|newspaper=Financial Times|issn=0307-1766|access-date=28 May 2016}}</ref>
As of September 2016, the accounts have 1.91M and 3.48M followers, respectively.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/earthpix|title=Earth Pics|publisher=Twitter|accessdate=26 October 2015}}{{Primary source inline|date=January 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/historyinpics|title=History in Pictures|publisher=Twitter|accessdate=26 October 2015}}{{Primary source inline|date=January 2018}}</ref> @EarthPix on Instagram has over 14M followers and is ranked the 113th Most Followed Instagram account.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://socialblade.com/instagram/user/earthpix|title=earthpix Instagram Stats Summary Profile (Social Blade Instagram Statistics)|website=''socialblade.com''|access-date=27 May 2016}}</ref>
At 17, Di Petta co-founded Social Trends Media; focusing on business development and partnerships. Social Trends Media earned $800,000 in sales in December 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/jjcolao/2014/02/27/the-1-million-a-month-business-behind-your-favorite-twitter-accounts/|title=The $1M-A-Month Business Behind Your Favorite Twitter Accounts|author=J.J. Colao|date=27 February 2014|work=Forbes|accessdate=26 October 2015}}</ref>
In May 2014, Di Petta was featured in a Special Interest Paper by the City of London on 'Cultural Innovation and Entrepreneurship in London'<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cityoflondon.gov.uk/business/economic-research-and-information/research-publications/Pages/Cultural-innovation-and-en.aspx|title=Cultural innovation and entrepreneurship in London|date=21 May 2014|website=Cultural innovation and entrepreneurship in London|publisher=City of London|access-date=27 May 2016}}</ref>
In October 2014, Di Petta joined the Advisory Board of the [[National Women's History Museum]] (NWHM), along with Gloria Steinem and Jenna Bush.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nwhm.org/about-nwhm/board/advisory-council | title=National Advisory Council | publisher=National Women's History Museum | accessdate=26 October 2015 }}</ref>
Di Petta has curated for [[Condé Nast]], including [[GQ]] and [[LOVE (magazine)|LOVE]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.gq.com/contributors/xavier-di-petta |title=Xavier Di Petta |work=GQ |date=4 January 2014 |accessdate=26 October 2015}}</ref> In December 2014, All Day Media (formerly Social Trends Media) raised $2,000,000 from investors including Upfront Ventures, 500 Startups and Daher Capital.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://techcrunch.com/2014/12/19/all-day-raises-2-million-to-be-a-media-portal-for-the-twitter-generation |title=All Day Raises $2 Million To Be A Media Portal for the Twitter Generation |publisher=TechCrunch |date=19 December 2014 |accessdate=26 October 2015}}</ref>
Di Petta was a speaker at [[TEDxTeen]] NYC in May 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tedxteen.com/speakers-performers/tedxteen-2015-nyc/270-xavier-di-petta |title=Xavier Di Petta |publisher=TEDxTeen.com |date=11 October 2014 |accessdate=26 October 2015}}</ref> Di Petta worked with [[World Wide Fund for Nature|WWF]] and [[Wieden+Kennedy|W+K]] to launch their #EndangeredEmoji Campaign.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://wklondon.com/news/all_clients/all_years/P0/wwf-endangeredemoji-turns-tweets-to-donations |title=WWF and W+K's #EndangeredEmoji Turns Tweets to Donations – Wieden + Kennedy |publisher=Wklondon.com |date=12 May 2015 |accessdate=26 October 2015}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
